1001.name: A Worthy Skull
1001.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

1002.name: Blood for the Blood God!
1002.rule: Score this immediately if three or more of your fighters made a Charge action in this phase. *(Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met)*.

1003.name: Coward!
1003.rule: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter begins a Move action adjacent to one of your fighters and ends it adjacent to none of your fighters.

1004.name: Draw the Gaze of Khorne
1004.rule: Score this immediately if your warband takes two or more enemy fighters out of action in this phase. *(Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met)*.

1005.name: It Begins
1005.rule: Score this in an end phase if at least one fighter from each warband is out of action.

1006.name: Khorne Cares Not
1006.rule: Score this in an end phase if five or more fighters are out of action.

1007.name: Khorne's Champion
1007.rule: Score this in the third end phase if all fighters except one of your fighters are out of action.

1008.name: Let the Blood Flow
1008.rule: Score this immediately if three or more of your fighters made a successful Attack action in this phase. *(Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met)*.

1009.name: There is Only Slaughter
1009.rule: Score this in an end phase if no fighter is holding an objective.

1010.name: Blood Offering
1010.rule: Choose a friendly fighter. They suffer 1 damage. Roll two extra attack dice for their first Attack action in the next activation.

1011.name: Blood Rain
1011.rule: All Attack actions in the next activation have the :atFury: characteristic, even if they would normally have the :atSmash: characteristic.

1012.name: Boon of Khorne
1012.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an enemy fighter out of action. Remove all wound tokens from one friendly fighter.

1013.name: Desecrate
1013.rule: Remove one objective that you hold from the battlefield.

1014.name: Final Blow
1014.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an enemy fighter's Attack action that takes an adjacent friendly fighter out of action. Their attacker suffers 1 damage.

1015.name: Fuelled by Slaughter
1015.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes a fighter out of action. A friendly fighter can make an Attack action.

1016.name: Insensate
1016.rule: The first friendly fighter who suffers any amount of damage in the next activation only suffers one damage.

1017.name: Khorne Calls
1017.rule: Roll one extra attack dice for your first Attack action in the next activation.

1018.name: Rebirth in Blood
1018.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes your last surviving fighter out of action. Roll a defence dice. If you roll a :dfBlock: or :dfCrit: remove all wound tokens from them, and place them on a starting hex in your territory.

1019.name: Skulls for the Skull Throne!
1019.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an enemy fighter out of action. Draw up to two power cards.

1020.name: Berserk Charge
1020.rule: Both :atFury: and :atSmash: symbols are successes when this fighter makes a Charge action.

1022.name: Deadly Spin
1022.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 3 - :boom: 1] \n Targets adjacent enemy fighters - roll for each.

1023.name: Ever-Advancing
1023.rule: **Reaction:** When this fighter could be driven back during an Attack action (whether or not your opponent chooses to do so), you can instead push them one hex.

1024.name: Frenzy
1024.rule: Roll an extra attack dice when this fighter makes a Charge action.

1025.name: Grisly Trophy
1025.rule: When this fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action, gain 1 additional glory point.

1026.name: Terrifying Howl
1026.rule: **Action:** Push each adjacent enemy fighter one hex.

1027.name: Unstoppable Charge
1027.rule: When this fighter makes a Charge action they can move through other fighters, but their move must end in an empty hex.

1028.name: Whirlwind of Death
1028.rule: +1 Damage to all Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2.

1029.name: Wicked Blade
1029.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 3 - :boom: 2] \n If you roll at least one :atCrit: this Attack action has Cleave.

1030.name: Awe-Inspiring
1030.rule: Score this immediately if your warband has taken two or more fighters out of action in this phase. *(Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met)*.

1031.name: Cleanse
1031.rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold all objectives *in enemy territory*.

1032.name: Consecrated Area
1032.rule: Score this in an end phase if  there are no enemy fighters adjacent to your fighters.

1033.name: Eternals
1033.rule: Score this in the third end phase if none of your fighters are out of action.

1034.name: Immovable Object
1034.rule: Score this in an end phase if  the same friendly fighter has held the same objective at the end of two consecutive action phases.

1035.name: Lightning Strikes
1035.rule: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter is taken out of action by a Charge action made by one of your fighters.

1036.name: Seize Ground
1036.rule: Score this in an end phase if  you hold an objective in enemy territory.

1037.name: Sigmar's Bulwark
1037.rule: Score this in an end phase if none of your fighters suffered any damage in the preceding action phase.

1038.name: Slayers of Tyrants
1038.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

1039.name: Heroic Guard
1039.rule: Choose a friendly fighter and put them on Guard.

1040.name: Peal of Thunder
1040.rule: Choose any enemy fighter and push them one hex in any direction.

1041.name: Righteous Zeal
1041.rule: +1 Damage to the first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 in the next activation.

1042.name: Sigmarite Wall
1042.rule: Choose two adjacent friendly fighters and put them on Guard.

1043.name: Stormforged Resistance
1043.rule: Friendly fighters cannot be driven back by the first Attack action in the next activation.

1044.name: Stormforged Tactics
1044.rule: In the next activation, you can make the following Reaction. \n **Reaction:** After an enemy fighter's Attack action that fails, choose up to two friendly fighters and push them up to one hex each.

1045.name: Tireless Assault
1045.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that fails. That fighter can make another Attack action that targets the same fighter.

1046.name: Undaunted
1046.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes a friendly fighter out of action leaving one surviving friendly fighter on the battlefield. Remove all wound tokens from the surviving fighter.

1047.name: Unstoppable Strike
1047.rule: The first Attack action in the next activation gains Cleave.

1048.name: Valiant Attack
1048.rule: Enemy fighters cannot support the target of the first Attack action in the next activation.

1050.name: Block
1050.rule: **Action:** This fighter and all adjacent friendly fighters go on Guard.

1051.name: Brave Strike
1051.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 2] \n Roll an extra attack dice if there are no adjacent friendly fighters.

1052.name: Fatal Riposte
1052.rule: **Reaction:** During an Attack action that targets this fighter and fails, roll an attack dice. On a roll of :atSmash: or :atCrit: this fighter cannot be driven back and they can make an Attack action. It must target the attacker.

1053.name: Heroic Might
1053.rule: This fighter's Attack action gains Cleave.

1054.name: Heroic Stride
1054.rule: **Reaction:** After an enemy fighter ends their activation within two hexes of this fighter, you can push this fighter one hex.

1055.name: Lightning Blade
1055.rule: [:Hex: 2 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 1] \n On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

1056.name: Lightning Blast
1056.rule: When they make a critical hit, this fighter also inflicts 1 damage on enemy fighters adjacent to the target's hex.

1057.name: Righteous Strike
1057.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 3 - :boom: 2] \n **Reaction:** After this Attack action, if it failed and the target was an enemy leader, make this Attack action again.

1058.name: Shield Bash
1058.rule: **Reaction:** During an adjacent fighter's Attack action that targets this fighter and fails, this fighter cannot be driven back and you can push their attacker one hex.

1059.name: Battle Without End
1059.rule: *(Errata update)* Score this in an end phase if one or more friendly fighters returned to the battlefield in the preceding action phase, and a friendly fighter had already returned to the battlefield in that phase.

1060.name: Claim the City
1060.rule: Score this in an end phase if  you hold *every objective*.

1061.name: Fearless in Death
1061.rule: Score this in an end phase if there is only one friendly fighter on the battlefield.

1062.name: March of the Dead
1062.rule: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters (at least five) made a Move action in the preceding action phase.

1063.name: More Able Bodies
1063.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took two or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.

1064.name: Peerless General
1064.rule: Score this in the third end phase if you have four or more surviving fighters, and none are Inspired.

1065.name: Skills Unforgotten
1065.rule: Score this immediately if your leader takes an enemy fighter out of action.

1066.name: The Invigorated Dead
1066.rule: Score this in the third end phase if all of your surviving fighters (at least three) are Inspired.

1067.name: Undead Swarm
1067.rule: Score this in an end phase *if each enemy fighter is adjacent to at least two friendly fighters*.

1068.name: Bone Shrapnel
1068.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an Attack action that takes a friendly fighter out of action. The fighter that took them out of action suffers 1 damage.

1069.name: Ceaseless Attacks
1069.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action. Make an Attack action with another friendly fighter.

1070.name: Clawing Hands
1070.rule: Each friendly fighter that is not on the battlefield is considered to be supporting the first Attack action in the next activation.

1071.name: Danse Macabre
1071.rule: Any friendly fighters that make a Move action in the next activation can move one additional hex.

1072.name: Grasping Hands
1072.rule: Reduce the Move characteristic of the first fighter to be activated in the next activation by the number of friendly fighters that are not on the battlefield, to a minimum of 0.

1073.name: Restless Dead
1073.rule: **Place** one friendly fighter that is out of action, other than the Sepulchral Warden, on a **starting** hex in your territory. **Give** that fighter one Raise counter.

1074.name: Spectral Form
1074.rule: Any friendly fighters that make a Move action in the next activation can move through additional fighters, but must end their moves on empty hexes.

1075.name: Swift Evasion
1075.rule: Choose one friendly fighter and push them up to two hexes. Their new position must be further away from all enemy fighters.

1076.name: Terrifying Screams
1076.rule: Choose an enemy fighter and push them one hex.

1077.name: The Necromancer Commands
1077.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that fails. Make the Attack action again.

1078.name: Ancient Commander
1078.rule: *(Errata update)* **Action:** Choose three other friendly fighters that have no Move or Charge tokens. Make one Move action with each of the chosen fighters.

1079.name: Assumed Command
1079.rule: Each friendly fighter that supports this fighter is considered to be two supporting fighters.

1080.name: Deathly Charge
1080.rule: This fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2 have +1 Damage in a phase in which they make a Charge action.

1081.name: Fatal Strike
1081.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 2] \n**Reaction:** Make this Attack action during an Attack action that takes this fighter out of action, before they are removed from the battlefield. It must target their attacker.

1082.name: Focused Attack
1082.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 2] \n If you roll at least one :atCrit: this Attack action has Cleave.

1084.name: Grim Cleave
1084.rule: This fighter's Attack actions gain Cleave.

1086.name: Remembered Shield
1086.rule: This fighter's Defence characteristic changes to :dfBlock:.

1088.name: 'Ard as Iron
1088.rule: Score this in the third end phase if none of your fighters are out of action.

1089.name: Biggest an' da Best
1089.rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader took an enemy fighter out of action in the preceding action phase.

1090.name: Call of the Waaagh!
1090.rule: Score this immediately if three or more of your fighters made a Charge action this phase. *(Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met)*.

1091.name: Dead Kunnin'
1091.rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter has two more supporting fighters than their target when making an Attack action.

1092.name: Dere's More of Us
1092.rule: Score this in an end phase if you have more fighters on the battlefield than *your opponent*.

1093.name: Get Da Boss
1093.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

1094.name: Good Scrap
1094.rule: Score this in an end phase if *three or more fighters* were taken out of action in the preceding action phase.

1095.name: Punch-Up
1095.rule: Score this in an end phase if each of your surviving fighters (at least two) made an Attack action against a different enemy fighter in the preceding action phase.

1096.name: Too Dumb to Die
1096.rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter suffers 3 or more damage in a single attack and is not take out of action.

1097.name: 'Avin' a Good Time
1097.rule: Choose a fighter and roll an attack dice. If you roll a :atSmash: or :atCrit: the can make an Attack action.

1098.name: Brutal But Kunnin'
1098.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action. You can push that fighter up to three hexes.

1099.name: Deafening Bellow
1099.rule: Choose an enemy fighter adjacent to one of your fighters. Push that fighter one hex.

1100.name: Gorkamorka's Blessing
1100.rule: The first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 in the next activation has +1 Damage.

1101.name: Kunnin' But Brutal
1101.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's Move action. That fighter can make an Attack action. You cannot play this during a Charge action.

1102.name: Last Lunge
1102.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during an Attack action or ploy that will take a friendly fighter out of action, before removing them from the battlefield. Roll an attack dice. On a roll of :atSmash: or :atCrit: make an Attack action with that fighter. It must target the attacker.

1103.name: Leadin' By Example
1103.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an Attack action made by your leader that takes an enemy fighter out of action. Another friendly fighter that has not already made a Move or Charge action can make a Charge action.

1104.name: More Choppin'
1104.rule: Roll an extra attack dice for the first Attack action in the next activation.

1105.name: Pillage
1105.rule: Remove one objective that you hold from the battlefield.

1106.name: Scrag 'Em
1106.rule: Each friendly fighter that supports the first Attack action in the next activation is considered to be two supporting fighters.

1107.name: 'Ard Head
1107.rule: When this fighter suffers damage, reduce that damage by 1 to a minimum of 1.

1108.name: Aspiring Boss
1108.rule: **Reaction:** During an Attack action by this fighter that targets an enemy leader and fails, you can re-roll one attack dice.

1109.name: Brutal Frenzy
1109.rule: Roll an extra attack dice when this fighter makes a Charge action.

1110.name: Brutal Swing
1110.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 3 - :boom: 2] \n Targets all adjacent enemy fighters - roll for each.

1111.name: Crush and Cleave
1111.rule: This fighter's Attack actions gain Cleave.

1112.name: Dead 'Ard
1112.rule: This fighter can only be driven back by a critical hit.

1113.name: 'Eadbutt
1113.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 2] \n If this Attack action succeeds, the target cannot be activated for the rest of the phase.

1114.name: Headlong Rush
1114.rule: This fighter's Attack actions gain Knockback 1 in a phase in which they make a Charge action.

1115.name: Unkillable
1115.rule: **Reaction:** During an Attack action or ploy that takes this fighter out of action, roll a defence dice. If you roll a :dfBlock: or :dfCrit: they suffer no damage and are not taken out of action, and you discard this upgrade.

1116.name: Waaagh!
1116.rule: This fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2 have +1 Damage in a phase in which they make a Charge action.

1117.name: A Claim Retaken
1117.rule: Score this in an end phase if a friendly fighter holds an objective that an enemy fighter held at the beginning of the preceding action phase.

1118.name: A Grim Promise
1118.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

1119.name: Ferocious Charge
1119.rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action with a Charge action.

1120.name: For the Ur-gold
1120.rule: Score this in an end phase if all your surviving fighters (at least three) are Inspired.

1121.name: Fury of the Lodge
1121.rule: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters (at least three) made a Charge action in the preceding action phase.

1122.name: Hoarders
1122.rule: Score this in an end phase if all of your fighters and no enemy fighters are holding objectives.

1123.name: Oaths Still to Fulfil
1123.rule: Score this in the third end phase if none of your fighters are out of action.

1124.name: Scion of Grimnir
1124.rule: Score this immediately if your leader takes an enemy fighter out of action.

1125.name: Unstoppable Advance
1125.rule: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters are in enemy territory.

1126.name: Berserk Fury
1126.rule: The first time a friendly fighter suffers damage in the next activation, roll a defence dice. If the result is a :dfBlock: they suffer no damage.

1127.name: Indomitable
1127.rule: The first time a friendly fighter suffers damage in the next activation, they only suffer 1 damage.

1128.name: Living Wall
1128.rule: Choose two friendly fighters and push each of them up to one hex. They must end up adjacent to one another.

1129.name: Oathsworn
1129.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that fails. That fighter can make another Attack action that targets the same fighter.

1130.name: Piercing Stare
1130.rule: Choose an enemy fighter. They cannot make an Attack action or a Charge action in the next activation.

1131.name: Slaying Blow
1131.rule: If the first Attack action in the next activation is a critical hit, double its Damage characteristic.

1132.name: The Earth Shakes
1132.rule: Choose a fighter and push them one hex.

1133.name: Treasure-lust
1133.rule: Choose a friendly fighter and push them up to three hexes. They must end up holding an objective.

1134.name: Ur-gold Boon
1134.rule: Choose a friendly fighter and roll a defence dice. On a roll of :dfBlock: or :dfCrit: remove up to two wound tokens from them. Otherwise remove one wound token from them.

1135.name: We Shall Not Be Moved
1135.rule: Friendly fighters holding objectives cannot be driven back by the first Attack action in the next activation.

1136.name: Activated Runes
1136.rule: Each time this fighter make an Attack action, you can re-roll one dice.

1137.name: Brute Strength
1137.rule: This fighter's Attack actions gain Knockback 1.

1138.name: Defiant Strike
1138.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 3 - :boom: 1] \n **Reaction:** During an Attack action that succeeds against this fighter, this fighter cannot be driven back and makes this Attack action. It must target the attacker.

1140.name: Great Swing
1140.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 2 - :boom: 2] \n Targets all adjacent enemy fighters - roll for each.

1141.name: Grimnir's Blessing
1141.rule: **Reaction:** During an Attack action or ploy that would take this fighter out of action, roll a defence dice. If you roll a :dfBlock: the damage suffered by this fighter is ignored.

1144.name: Returning Axe
1144.rule: [:Hex: 3 - :atFury: 2 - :boom: 1] \n On a critical hit this Attack action has +1 Damage.

1145.name: War Song
1145.rule: This fighter is considered to be two supporting fighters when they support, rather than one.

1146.name: Arm's Length
1146.rule: Score this immediately if your warband takes an enemy fighter out of action while they are adjacent to none of your fighters.

1147.name: Brilliant, Brilliant!
1147.rule: Score this in an end phase if you scored two or more other objective cards in the preceding action phase.

1148.name: Feast-feast
1148.rule: Score this in an end phase if *all enemy fighters* have been taken out of action.

1149.name: Honed Survival Instincts
1149.rule: Score this in an end phase if no friendly fighter was taken out of action in the preceding action phase.

1150.name: Leading from the Back
1150.rule: Score this in the third end phase if your leader is in your territory and not adjacent to an enemy.

1151.name: Live to Fight Another Day
1151.rule: Score this in the third end phase if the only surviving friendly fighter is your leader.

1152.name: Lives are Cheap
1152.rule: *(Errata update)* Score this in an end phase if one or more friendly fighters were taken out of action in the preceding action phase, and a friendly fighter had already been taken out of action in that phase.

1153.name: Numberless Swarm
1153.rule: Score this in the third end phase if there are five friendly fighters on the battlefield.

1154.name: Skritch is the Greatest, Yes-yes
1154.rule: Score this immediately if your leader takes an enemy fighter out of action.

1155.name: Aversion to Death
1155.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an Attack action that takes a friendly fighter out of action. Push up to two friendly fighters one hex each.

1156.name: Frenzied Stabbing
1156.rule: The first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 in the next activation has +1 Damage.

1157.name: Heightened Caution
1157.rule: Roll an extra defence dice for the first friendly fighter to be targeted by an Attack action in the next activation.

1158.name: Momentary Boldness
1158.rule: Choose a friendly fighter adjacent to two or more friendly fighters. That fighter makes a Charge action.

1159.name: Musk of Fear
1159.rule: Choose a friendly fighter and put them on Guard.

1160.name: Nervous Scrabbling
1160.rule: Choose a friendly fighter. They switch places with any adjacent fighter.

1161.name: Scratching in the Shadows
1161.rule: Choose an enemy fighter and push them one hex.

1162.name: Skaven Courage
1162.rule: Play this if there are at least three friendly fighters adjacent to the same enemy fighter. One of those friendly fighters can make an Attack action.

1163.name: Sudden Skittering
1163.rule: Double the Move characteristic of the first friendly fighter to make a Move action in the next activation. They may not make a Charge action. Once they have moved, they cannot be activated again this phase.

1164.name: There Are Always More
1164.rule: Choose one friendly fighter that is out of action (other than Skritch or Krrk). Remove all wound tokens from them and place them on any starting hex.

1165.name: Black Hunger
1165.rule: This fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 have +1 Damage, and target all adjacent fighters (friend and foe) - roll for each. Fighters do not provide support for Attack actions against friendly models (in attack or defence).

1166.name: Bodyguard for a Price
1166.rule: If Skritch is adjacent to this fighter, Skritch is on Guard (even if Skritch has made a Charge action this phase).

1167.name: Expendable
1167.rule: *(Errata update)* **Reaction:** During an enemy fighter's Attack action that targets this fighter, after the determine success step, if the Attack action is successful, deal 1 damage to the attacker. Then the Attack action fails, the combat sequence ends, and this fighter is taken out of action. No player gains a glory point for this fighter being taken out of action in this way.

1168.name: Festering Blades
1168.rule: On a critical hit, this fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2 have +2 Damage.

1169.name: Flee!
1169.rule: **Action:** This fighter and one adjacent friendly fighter can make a Move action. Both fighters must end their move further away from all enemy fighters.

1170.name: Skitter-scurry
1170.rule: **Reaction:** After any action that this fighter makes, you can push this fighter one hex.

1171.name: Sneaky Stab-stab
1171.rule: You can push this fighter one hex before they take an Attack action, though not when this fighter takes a Charge action.

1172.name: Swarm of Rats
1172.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 3 - :boom: 1] \n Targets all adjacent enemy fighters - roll for each.

1174.name: Whirling Halberd
1174.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 2 - :boom: 2] \n Targets all adjacent enemy fighters - roll for each.

1175.name: All the Better to Slay Them
1175.rule: Score this immediately if all friendly fighters (at least three) are adjacent to a different enemy fighter.

1176.name: Bane of Champions
1176.rule: Score this immediately if Riptooth takes an enemy leader out of action.

1177.name: Bloody Annihilation
1177.rule: Score this in an end phase *if all enemy fighters have been taken out of action*.

1178.name: Khorne Sees Us
1178.rule: Score this immediately if your warband takes two or more enemy fighters out of action in a phase. *(Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met)*.

1179.name: Kill! Kill Again!
1179.rule: Score this in an end phase if at least two fighters from each warband are out of action.

1180.name: No Escape
1180.rule: Score this immediately if three or more of your fighters made a Charge action this phase. *(Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met)*.

1181.name: Rivers of Blood
1181.rule: Score this in an end phase if all surviving fighters (at least four) are wounded.

1182.name: Save the Best
1182.rule: Score this in an end phase if an enemy leader is the only surviving enemy fighter.

1183.name: Show of Strength
1183.rule: Score this immediately if your leader takes an enemy fighter out of action.

1184.name: Blood Frenzy
1184.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes a fighter out of action. Roll one extra attack dice for the first Attack action in the next activation. Both :atSmash: and :atFury: are successes for that Attack action.

1185.name: Bloodslick Ground
1185.rule: In the next activation, enemy fighters have -2 Move.

1186.name: Bloody Retribution
1186.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an Attack action that takes a friendly fighter out of action. A friendly fighter adjacent to the attacker makes an Attack action against that fighter.

1187.name: Continue the Slaughter
1187.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes a fighter out of action. The first Attack action in the next activation has +1 Damage.

1188.name: Daemonic Resilience
1188.rule: The first friendly fighter who suffers any amount of damage in the next activation only suffers 1 damage.

1189.name: Fountain of Gore
1189.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes a fighter out of action. All friendly fighters have +1 Defence in the next activation.

1190.name: Furious Inspiration
1190.rule: Choose a friendly fighter. The become Inspired.

1191.name: Glory to Khorne
1191.rule: Roll one extra attack dice for the first Attack action made by a friendly fighter in the next activation.

1192.name: Horrifying Howl
1192.rule: Choose an enemy fighter that is adjacent to a friendly fighter and push them up to two hexes.

1193.name: To the Victor, the Spoils
1193.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an enemy fighter with a Wounds characteristic of 3 or more out of action. Draw three power cards.

1194.name: Brutal Charge
1194.rule: Roll an extra attack dice when this fighter makes a Charge action.

1195.name: Daemonic Maw
1195.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 2 - :boom: 3] \n If this Attack action succeeds, remove one wound token from this fighter.

1196.name: Furious Charge
1196.rule: When this fighter makes a Charge action both :atSmash: and :atFury: are successes.

1197.name: No Respite
1197.rule: **Reaction:** During an Attack action or ploy that will take this fighter out of action, you can make an Attack action with them.

1198.name: Predatory Leap
1198.rule: When this fighter makes a Charge action they can move through other fighters, but their move must end in an empty hex.

1199.name: Rage-fuelled Attacks
1199.rule: This fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2 have +1 Damage.

1200.name: Shake About
1200.rule: This fighter's successful Attack actions with a Range of 1 can push the target one hex (instead of driving them back) in addition to inflicting damage.

1201.name: Trophy Hunter
1201.rule: When this fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action, gain 1 additional glory point.

1202.name: Unshakeable
1202.rule: **Reaction:** During an Attack action that could drive this fighter back (whether or not your opponent chooses to do so), you can instead push them one hex.

1203.name: Wrathful Blows
1203.rule: All of this fighter's Attack actions have +1 Dice.

1204.name: Behead the Beast
1204.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

1205.name: Brave but Cautious
1205.rule: Score this in an end phase if you have at least one surviving fighter and none of your fighters suffered any damage in the preceding action phase.

1206.name: Close with the Enemy
1206.rule: Score this in an end phase if three friendly fighters are adjacent to enemy fighters.

1207.name: Eternal Supremacy
1207.rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold three or more objectives.

1208.name: Lightning Advance
1208.rule: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters (at least two) are in enemy territory.

1209.name: Meticulous Annihilation
1209.rule: Score this in an end phase if *all enemy fighters* have been taken out of action.

1210.name: Punishing Volleys
1210.rule: Score this in an end phase if you made at least three successful Boltstorm Pistol or Overcharged Boltstorm Pistol Attack actions in the preceding action phase.

1211.name: Ranger Strike
1211.rule: Score this immediately if your warband has taken two or more fighters out of action in this phase. *(Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met)*.

1212.name: Sigmar's Finest
1212.rule: Score this in an end phase if your surviving fighters (at least one) are outnumbered by surviving enemy fighters by at least *three to one*.

1213.name: Fearsome Roar
1213.rule: Choose an enemy fighter adjacent to a friendly fighter. Push them one hex.

1214.name: Firm Footing
1214.rule: Roll an extra defence dice for friendly fighters holding objectives in the next activation.

1215.name: Lightning Blow
1215.rule: The first Attack action in the next activation has +1 Damage.

1216.name: Lightning Stride
1216.rule: Double the Move characteristic of the first friendly fighter to make a Move action in the next activation. They may not make a Charge action. Once they have moved, they cannot be activated again this phase.

1217.name: Patient Defence
1217.rule: The first friendly fighter to be targeted by an Attack action in the next activation has +1 Defence.

1218.name: Rangers, Advance
1218.rule: Choose two friendly fighters and push them one hex.

1219.name: Rapid Volley
1219.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's Boltstorm Pistol or Overcharged Boltstorm Pistol Attack action. That fighter can make another Boltstorm Pistol or Overcharged Boltstorm Pistol Attack action that targets the same fighter.

1220.name: Retribution
1220.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an Attack action that damages a friendly fighter. That fighter can make an Attack action that must target the attacker.

1221.name: Steady Volley
1221.rule: The first friendly fighter to make a Boltstorm Pistol or Overcharged Bolstorm Pistol Attack action in the next activation can be pushed one hex before they do so.

1222.name: Warning Cry
1222.rule: Choose a friendly fighter and put them on Guard.

1223.name: Aetheric Step
1223.rule: This fighter can move through other fighters during a Move action, but must end their move in an empty hex.

1224.name: Covering Fire
1224.rule: This fighter can support an adjacent friendly fighter targeted by an Attack action, even if this fighter is not adjacent to the attacker.

1226.name: Furious Blow
1226.rule: **Reaction:** During an Attack action that targets this fighter and has failed, this fighter cannot be driven back and can make an Attack action. It must target the attacker.

1227.name: Lone Warrior
1227.rule: Rolls of :dfSup1: made for this fighter when they are targeted by an Attack action also count as successes when they are adjacent to no friendly fighters.

1229.name: Sharp Eyes
1229.rule: This fighter's Attack actions gain Cleave.

1230.name: Spinning Strike
1230.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 3 - :boom: 1] \n Targets all adjacent enemy fighters - roll for each.

1233.name: Accept Inevitability
1233.rule: Score this in the third end phase if all of your fighters are out of action.

1234.name: Advancing Strike
1234.rule: Score this immediately when your warband takes an enemy fighter standing in enemy territory out of action.

1235.name: Alone in the Darkness
1235.rule: Score this in an end phase if there are no adjacent fighters on the battlefield.

1236.name: Annihilation
1236.rule: Score this in an end phase if *all enemy fighters have been taken out of action*.

1237.name: Assassinate
1237.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

1238.name: Balance of Power
1238.rule: Score this immediately when making an Attack action if both the attacker and the target have two supporting fighters.

1239.name: Blooded
1239.rule: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters (at least three) have at least one wound token.

1240.name: Bloodless
1240.rule: Score this in an end phase if no fighter suffered any damage in the preceding action phase.

1241.name: Brawl
1241.rule: Score this in an end phase if all friendly fighters (at least three) are adjacent to enemy fighters.

1242.name: Butchery
1242.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took three or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.

1243.name: Change of Tactics
1243.rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter on Guard makes a Charge action.

1244.name: Chosen Champion
1244.rule: Score this in an end phase if a surviving friendly fighter has three or more upgrades.

1245.name: Complete Victory
1245.rule: Score this in the third end phase if none of your fighters are out of action.

1246.name: Concerted Attack
1246.rule: Score this immediately if three or more friendly fighters made an Attack action against the same enemy fighter in this phase. *(Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met)*.

1247.name: Conquest
1247.rule: Score this in the third end phase if all of your surviving fighters are *in your opponent's territory*.

1248.name: Contained
1248.rule: Score this in the third end phase *if all surviving enemy fighters are in their territory*.

1249.name: Cover Ground
1249.rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes a Move action of six or more hexes.

1250.name: Crushing Force
1250.rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes a successful attack that deals at least twice as much damage as is needed to take their target out of action.

1251.name: Dauntless
1251.rule: Score this in an end phase if your fighters are outnumbered by *at least three to one*.

1252.name: Defensive Strike
1252.rule: Score this immediately when your warband takes an enemy fighter standing in your territory out of action.

1253.name: Denial
1253.rule: Score this in the third end phase if there are no enemy fighters in your territory.

1254.name: Determined Defender
1254.rule: Score this in an end phase if the same friendly fighter has held the same objective at the end of two consecutive action phases.

1255.name: Divide and Conquer
1255.rule: Score this in an end phase if each player has at least one fighter in their own territory and at least one fighter in enemy territory.

1256.name: Endless Slaughter
1256.rule: Score this in the third end phase if *five* or more enemy fighters are out of action.

1257.name: Escalation
1257.rule: Score this in an end phase if *three or more upgrade cards* were played in the preceding action phase.

1258.name: Fearless
1258.rule: Score this in an end phase if there are at least three enemy fighters adjacent to the same friendly fighter.

1259.name: Flawless Strategy
1259.rule: Score this in an end phase if you scored two or more other objective cards in this phase.

1260.name: Geared for War
1260.rule: Score this in an end phase if each of your surviving fighters (at least three) has at least one upgrade.

1261.name: Heroes All
1261.rule: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters (at least three) are Inspired.

1262.name: Heroic Feat
1262.rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter's Attack action succeeds when their target has two or more supporting fighters more then the attacker.

1263.name: Hold Objective 1
1263.rule: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective *1*.

1264.name: Hold Objective 2
1264.rule: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective *2*.

1265.name: Hold Objective 3
1265.rule: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective *3*.

1266.name: Hold Objective 4
1266.rule: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective *4*.

1267.name: Hold Objective 5
1267.rule: Score this in an end phase if you are holding objective *5*.

1268.name: Honest Opponent
1268.rule: Score this in an end phase if you played no ploy cards during the preceding action phase.

1269.name: Killing Ground
1269.rule: Score this in an end phase if at least one fighter was taken out of action in the preceding action phase in enemy territory, in your territory and in no one's territory.

1270.name: Making a Statement
1270.rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold *all objectives (at least one) in your opponent's territory*.

1271.name: Massive Assault
1271.rule: Score this immediately if your fighters deal 7 or more damage in an action phase (damage in excess of a fighter's Wounds characteristic is included). *(Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met)*.

1272.name: Master of War
1272.rule: Score this in an end phase if you scored an objective card, played a ploy card and played an upgrade card in this round.

1273.name: Masterstroke
1273.rule: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter is taken out of action by an Attack action made as a Reaction by your warband or a Reaction made by your warband that causes damage.

1274.name: Miraculous Escape
1274.rule: Score this immediately if one of your fighters is the target of an enemy Attack action with a Dice characteristic of 3 or more that fails.

1275.name: Multiple Fronts
1275.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband dealt damage to three or more enemy fighters in the preceding action phase.

1276.name: No More Tricks
1276.rule: Score this in an end phase if you have no power cards in your hand.

1277.name: No Remorse
1277.rule: Score this immediately if one of your fighters takes an enemy fighter out of action with an Attack action with a Damage characteristic greater than the target's Wounds characteristic.

1278.name: Our Only Way Out
1278.rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold three or more objectives.

1279.name: Overextended
1279.rule: Score this in an end phase *if you hold every objective*.

1280.name: Perfect Planning
1280.rule: Score this in an end phase if none of your fighters made a Move action in the preceding action phase.

1281.name: Plant a Standard
1281.rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader is holding an objective in enemy territory.

1282.name: Ploymaster
1282.rule: Score this in an end phase if you played three or more ploys in the preceding action phase.

1283.name: Poised to Strike
1283.rule: Score this in an end phase if at least three friendly fighters are adjacent to the same enemy fighter.

1284.name: Precise Use of Force
1284.rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes a successful Attack action that deals exactly enough damage to take their target out of action.

1285.name: Pure Carnage
1285.rule: Score this in the third end phase if *seven or more* fighters are out of action.

1286.name: Ready for a Challenge
1286.rule: Score this in an end phase if all remaining enemy fighters (at least three) have an upgrade.

1287.name: Reaper
1287.rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter's attack takes two or more enemy fighters out of action.

1288.name: Scent of Victory
1288.rule: Score this in an end phase if all surviving enemy fighters (at least three) have at least one wound token.

1289.name: Skirting Danger
1289.rule: Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters (at least two) are on edge hexes.

1290.name: Stymied
1290.rule: Score this in an end phase if *your opponent played no power cards* in the preceding action phase.

1291.name: Superior Tactician
1291.rule: Score this in the third end phase if you have scored six or more other objective cards.

1292.name: Supremacy
1292.rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold three or more objectives.

1293.name: Swift Advance
1293.rule: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters are in enemy territory.

1294.name: Tactical Genius 1-3
1294.rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold objectives 1, 2 and 3.

1295.name: Tactical Genius 3-5
1295.rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold objectives 3, 4 and 5.

1296.name: Tactical Supremacy 1-2
1296.rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold objectives 1 and 2.

1297.name: Tactical Supremacy 3-4
1297.rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold objectives 3 and 4.

1298.name: The Bigger They Are
1298.rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action with an Attack action that had a Damage characteristic of 1.

1299.name: The Harvest Begins
1299.rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes an Attack action that damages three or more enemy fighters.

1300.name: Total Annihilation
1300.rule: Score this in the first or second end phase if all enemy fighters have been taken out of action.

1301.name: Trapped
1301.rule: Score this immediately if an enemy fighter takes damage from a friendly fighter's Attack action because they cannot be driven back.

1302.name: Twilight Conqueror
1302.rule: Score this in an end phase if all of your surviving fighters (at least three) are neither in your territory nor enemy territory.

1303.name: Unbroken Wall
1303.rule: Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters (at least three) are in a single group with each friendly fighter adjacent to another friendly fighter.

1304.name: Unstoppable
1304.rule: Score this immediately if one of your fighters makes a successful Attack action against an enemy fighter on Guard.

1305.name: Victorious Duel
1305.rule: Score this immediately if your leader takes an enemy leader out of action.

1306.name: Victory After Victory
1306.rule: Score this in an end phase if you scored three or more other objective cards in this round.

1307.name: War of Attrition
1307.rule: Score this in an end phase if the same number of fighters (at least one) from each warband are out of action.

1308.name: Anticipation
1308.rule: Play this card after the final activation in an action phase. Name an objective card. If an opponent scores that objective in the end phase, score a glory point.

1309.name: Blinding Flash
1309.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during an Attack action with a Range of 3 or greater (before any dice are rolled). The Attacks characteristic of that Attack action is changed to :atFury: 1.

1310.name: Confused Priorities
1310.rule: Switch two objectives that are currently being held.

1311.name: Confusion
1311.rule: Choose two fighters that are adjacent to each other and switch them.

1312.name: Cruel Taunt
1312.rule: Choose an enemy fighter and roll an attack dice. On a roll of :atSmash: or :atCrit: they are no longer Inspired, and cannot be Inspired this game.

1313.name: Curious Inversion
1313.rule: For the first Attack action in the next activation, :atSmash: characteristics become :atFury: characteristics and vice versa, and :dfDodge: characteristics become :dfBlock: characteristics and vice versa.

1314.name: Darkness Descends
1314.rule: The first Attack action in the next activation has a Range of 1.

1315.name: Daylight Robbery
1315.rule: Roll an attack dice. If you roll a :atSmash: or :atCrit: take one of your opponent's unspent glory points.

1316.name: Death Throes
1316.rule: **Reaction:** Play this card during an Attack action or ploy that will take a friendly fighter out of action. Choose an enemy fighter adjacent to the target. They suffer 1 damage.

1317.name: Desperate Gambit
1317.rule: When resolving the first Attack action in the next activation, you and your opponent roll off. The winner chooses whether the Attack action fails or succeeds.

1318.name: Distraction
1318.rule: Choose an enemy fighter and push them one hex.

1319.name: Dual Strike
1319.rule: One fighter supporting the first Attack action in the next activation is considered to be two supporting fighters.

1320.name: Duel of Wits
1320.rule: **Reaction:** Play this when an opponent plays a ploy. Draw two power cards.

1321.name: Earthquake
1321.rule: Push all fighters one hex. You must push them all in the same direction. Any that cannot be pushed this way are not pushed.

1322.name: Ephemeral Shield
1322.rule: The first friendly fighter to be targeted by an Attack action in the next activation has +1 Defence.

1323.name: Flickering Step
1323.rule: Roll eight dice. Choose a friendly fighter and push them up to a number of hexes equal to the number of :atCrit: rolled.

1324.name: Forceful Denial
1324.rule: **Reaction:** Play this when an opponent plays a ploy. Roll a defence dice. On a roll of :dfBlock: or :dfCrit: that ploy has no effect.

1325.name: Fortify
1325.rule: Friendly fighters holding objectives have +1 Defence for the next activation.

1326.name: Frozen in Time
1326.rule: Choose an enemy fighter and roll a defence dice. On a roll of :dfBlock: or :dfCrit: that fighter cannot make any actions or be damaged in this phase.

1327.name: Fuelled by Fury
1327.rule: You can re-roll any attack dice for the first friendly fighter's Attack action in the next activation.

1328.name: Grapple
1328.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an adjacent enemy fighter makes an Attack action that drives a friendly fighter back. Push the attacker into the hex the friendly fighter was driven back from.

1329.name: Great Concussion
1329.rule: Choose a hex on the battlefield, then push all fighters one hex (in whichever order you choose). This push must move them away from the chosen hex. If there is no hex you could push a fighter into, do not push them.

1330.name: Healing Potion
1330.rule: Choose a friendly fighter and roll a defence dice. On a roll of :dfBlock: or :dfCrit: remove up to two wound tokens from them. Otherwise remove one wound token from them.

1331.name: Hidden Paths
1331.rule: Choose a friendly fighter that hasn't made a Move action this phase and is on any edge hex. Place them on any other edge hex. They are considered to have made a Move action.

1332.name: Illusory Fighter
1332.rule: Choose one of your fighters on the battlefield. Place them on a starting hex in your territory.

1333.name: Improvisation
1333.rule: Discard all power cards in your hand and draw three power cards.

1334.name: Inspiration Strikes
1334.rule: Choose a friendly fighter. They become Inspired.

1335.name: Invisible Walls
1335.rule: All fighters' Move characteristics are reduced to 1 for the next activation.

1336.name: Last Chance
1336.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during an Attack action that would take a friendly fighter out of action. Roll a defence dice. If the result would not normally be a success for this fighter, ignore the damage from that Attack action on this fighter.

1337.name: Legacy
1337.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes a friendly fighter out of action. Choose one of their universal upgrades and give it to an adjacent friendly fighter.

1338.name: Lethal Strike
1338.rule: If the first Attack action in the next activation is a critical hit, double its Damage characteristic for that Attack action.

1339.name: Mighty Swing
1339.rule: Your first Attack action with a Range characteristic of 1 in the next activation targets all adjacent enemy fighters. Roll for each.

1340.name: Mischievous Spirits
1340.rule: Taking it in turns with your opponent(s), starting with you and going clockwise, move each objective one hex. Objectives cannot be moved into a hex that already contains an objective.

1341.name: Misdirection
1341.rule: **Reaction:** Play this when a friendly fighter is chosen by a ploy. Choose another friendly fighter that could be chosen by that ploy. That fighter is chosen instead.

1342.name: Momentary Madness
1342.rule: Choose an enemy fighter and roll an attack dice. If you roll a :atSmash: or :atCrit: make an Attack action with them as if they were a friendly fighter. Fighters do not provide support for this Attack action (in attack or defence).

1343.name: My Turn
1343.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an Attack action or ploy that damages a friendly fighter. Push them up to one hex and make an Attack action with them.

1344.name: No Time
1344.rule: No more power cards can be played until after the next activation.

1345.name: On Your Feet
1345.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during an Attack action or ploy that would take a friendly fighter out of action, when there is a friendly fighter adjacent to them. Roll a defence dice. On a roll of :dfBlock: or :dfCrit: the fighter does not suffer damage and is not taken out of action.

1346.name: Parry
1346.rule: The first time one of your fighters is targeted in the next activation, roll an extra defence dice. When counting your successes, ignore one of the defence dice.

1347.name: Quick Thinker
1347.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an enemy fighter's Move action. Make a Move action with a friendly fighter who has not already made a Move action in this phase.

1348.name: Ready for Action
1348.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after you upgrade a fighter in an action phase. They can make a Move or Attack action.

1349.name: Rebound
1349.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during an enemy Attack action that would succeed. Roll a defence dice. On a roll of :dfDodge: or :dfCrit: the attacker suffers the damage, rather than the target, and neither fighter is driven back.

1350.name: Reflected Injury
1350.rule: Choose a friendly fighter with at least one wound token, and an adjacent enemy fighter. The enemy fighter suffers 1 damage.

1351.name: Rethink Strategy
1351.rule: Discard any number of objective cards and draw that number of objective cards.

1352.name: Sacrificial Pawn
1352.rule: Choose a friendly fighter. If they are taken out of action in the next activation, you gain a glory point.

1353.name: Scavenge
1353.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an adjacent enemy fighter with an upgrade out of action. Gain an additional glory point.

1354.name: Second Wind
1354.rule: *(Errata update)* Choose a friendly fighter that has one or more Charge tokens. In the next activation, treat the chosen fighter as if they had one fewer Charge tokens than they have, and one more Move token than they have.

1355.name: Shardfall
1355.rule: Place a Shardfall token in an unoccupied hex. That hex is blocked until the end of the phase.

1357.name: Shattering Terrain
1357.rule: Any fighters that make a Move action, are pushed or are driven back in the next activation suffer 1 damage.

1358.name: Shattershard
1358.rule: Choose an enemy fighter, and choose one of their upgrades. Roll an attack dice. On a roll of :atSmash: or :atCrit: that upgrade is discarded.

1359.name: Shifting Shards
1359.rule: Move an unheld objective one hex. You cannot move it into a hex that already contains an objective.

1360.name: Sidestep
1360.rule: Choose a friendly fighter and push them one hex.

1361.name: Spectral Wings
1361.rule: The first fighter to make a Move action in the next activation has +2 Move.

1362.name: Spoils of Battle
1362.rule: Play an upgrade card. This doesn't cost a glory point.

1363.name: Sprint
1363.rule: Double the move characteristic of the first friendly fighter to make a Move action in the next activation. They may not make a Charge action. Once they have moved, they cannot be activated again in this phase.

1364.name: Stumble
1364.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action drives an enemy fighter back. They are driven back an additional hex in the same direction.

1365.name: Tainted Vitality
1365.rule: Remove one wound token from each fighter who has at least one wound token.

1366.name: Tantalising Prize
1366.rule: The first friendly fighter to take a Move action in the next activation can move up to an additional two hexes if they end their move on an objective.

1367.name: Teamwork
1367.rule: **Reaction:** Play this card during a friendly fighter's Attack action, before rolling any dice. Push another friendly fighter one hex.

1368.name: Time Trap
1368.rule: Choose a fighter. They can take an action. Skip your next activation (you cannot play this card after your fourth activation).

1369.name: Trap
1369.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during a friendly fighter's Attack action that drives an enemy fighter back. The enemy fighter suffers 1 damage.

1370.name: Triumphant Roar
1370.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an enemy fighter out of action. You can push each enemy fighter adjacent to the friendly fighter one hex.

1371.name: Trust to Luck
1371.rule: Discard any number of power cards and draw up to that number of power cards from your deck.

1372.name: Twist the Knife
1372.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during a friendly fighter's Attack action that has a Range of 1 and will succeed. It has +1 Damage for that Attack action.

1373.name: A Destiny to Meet
1373.rule: If this fighter is not out of action at the end of the third action phase, gain 1 additional glory point.

1374.name: Acrobatic
1374.rule: If this fighter has a :dfDodge: Defence characteristic or has a :dfBlock: Defence characteristic but is on Guard, roll an extra defence dice when they are the target of an Attack action.

1375.name: Army of One
1375.rule: If this fighter is the last friendly fighter on the battlefield, they have +1 Defence and all of their Attack actions have +1 Dice.

1376.name: Awakened Weapon
1376.rule: You can re-roll one attack dice each time this fighter makes an Attack action.

1377.name: Blessed Armour
1377.rule: When you roll a :dfCrit: for this fighter when they are targeted by an Attack action, remove one wound token from them before any damage is dealt.

1378.name: Concealed Weapon
1378.rule: On a critical hit, this fighter's Attack actions with a Range of 1 have +2 Damage.

1379.name: Coordinated Attack
1379.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 2 - :boom: 2] \n When making this Attack action, roll an extra attack dice for each other friendly fighter adjacent to the target.

1380.name: Cunning Duellist
1380.rule: **Reaction:** During this fighter's Attack action that succeeds against an adjacent enemy fighter, instead of driving the target back you can switch the two fighters' places.

1382.name: Daemonic Weapon
1382.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 3] \n Each time this fighter makes this Attack action, they first suffer 1 damage.

1385.name: Disengage
1385.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 1] \n **Reaction:** After this Attack action, if it is successful, you can push this fighter one hex.

1386.name: Ethereal Shield
1386.rule: This fighter's Defence characteristic changes to :dfBlock:.

1387.name: Flickering Image
1387.rule: **Reaction:** After an Attack action made by this fighter that scores a critical hit, you can push them up to two hexes.

1388.name: Ghostblade
1388.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 1] \n When rolling defence dice, only rolls of :dfCrit: are successes for the target of this Attack action. This Attack action can never cause more than 1 damage to a target.

1391.name: Great Strength
1391.rule: +1 Damage to all Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2.

1392.name: Headlong Charge
1392.rule: When this fighter makes a Charge action, increase their Move characteristic by 1 until the end of the activation.

1393.name: Helpful Whispers
1393.rule: If this fighter has no adjacent friendly fighters, rolls of :atSup1: are a success when they make an Attack action.

1395.name: Incredible Strength
1395.rule: +1 Damage to all Attack actions with a Range of 1 or 2.

1396.name: Katophrane's Belt
1396.rule:
*(Errata update)* 
 **Katophrane Relic** 
 A player can only play this card by spending two glory points (instead of one) and applying the upgrade card to an eligible fighter. If this fighter has two or more **Katophrane Relics**, they gain the following (cumulative) abilities. 
 **2+ Relics: Reaction:** During an Attack action that targets this fighter, re-roll the defence dice. 
 **3+ Relics: Reaction:** During this fighter's Attack action, re-roll the attack dice. 
 **4+ Relics: Reaction:** After this fighter's action, draw two power cards. 
 **6+ Relics: Action:** Gain 4 glory points.

1397.name: Katophrane's Boots
1397.rule:
*(Errata update)* 
 **Katophrane Relic** 
 A player can only play this card by spending two glory points (instead of one) and applying the upgrade card to an eligible fighter. If this fighter has two or more **Katophrane Relics**, they gain the following (cumulative) abilities. 
 **2+ Relics: Reaction:** During an Attack action that targets this fighter, re-roll the defence dice. 
 **3+ Relics: Reaction:** During this fighter's Attack action, re-roll the attack dice. 
 **4+ Relics: Reaction:** After this fighter's action, draw two power cards. 
 **6+ Relics: Action:** Gain 4 glory points.

1398.name: Katophrane's Gloves
1398.rule:

1403.name: Light Armour
1403.rule: Rolls of :dfCrit: on a defence dice are no longer a success for this fighter. Roll an extra attack dice when this fighter make an Attack action.

1404.name: Light-footed
1404.rule: **Reaction:** During an Attack action that could drive this fighter back (whether or not your opponent chose to), you can instead push them one hex.

1405.name: Low Blow
1405.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 1] \n Both :atFury:and :atSmash: symbols are successes for this Attack action.

1406.name: Opportunist
1406.rule: **Reaction:** After a failed Attack action that targets this fighter, you can push them one hex.

1407.name: Regeneration
1407.rule: At the beginning of each action phase, remove up to one wound token from this fighter.

1408.name: Second-in-command
1408.rule: If your warband's leader is out of action, this fighter is considered to be a leader. While this fighter is on the battlefield, opponents cannot score objectives for having taken your leader out of action.

1409.name: Shadeglass Axe
1409.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 2] \n When this Attack action is successful, discard this upgrade. On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage. \n [:Hex: 3 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 2] After a fighter makes this Attack action, discard this upgrade. On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

1410.name: Shadeglass Dagger
1410.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 3 - :boom: 3] \n When this Attack action is successful, discard this upgrade. On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

1411.name: Shadeglass Darts
1411.rule: [:Hex: 3 - :atFury: 3 - :boom: 1] \n On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

1412.name: Shadeglass Hammer
1412.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 3] \n When this Attack action is successful, discard this upgrade. On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

1413.name: Shadeglass Spear
1413.rule: [:Hex: 2 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 2] \n When this Attack action is successful, discard this upgrade. On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

1414.name: Shadeglass Sword
1414.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 3 - :boom: 2] \n When this Attack action is successful, discard this upgrade. On a critical hit, this Attack action has +1 Damage.

1415.name: Shadestep
1415.rule: This fighter can move through other fighters during a Move action, but must end their move in an empty hex.

1416.name: Shardcaller
1416.rule: At the beginning of each action phase, you can switch an objective held by this fighter with any other objective.

1417.name: Shifting Image
1417.rule: **Reaction:** After any Attack action in which you roll a :atCrit: for this fighter (with an attack or defence dice), you can push this fighter one hex.

1418.name: Sixth Sense
1418.rule: Your opponent can never consider a :atSup2: as a success for Attack actions that target this fighter.

1419.name: Solid Stance
1419.rule: This fighter can only be driven back by a critical hit.

1420.name: Soultrap
1420.rule: **Reaction:** During an Attack action or ploy that takes this fighter out of action, roll a defence dice. If you roll a :dfBlock: or :dfCrit: they suffer no damage and are not taken out of action, and you discard this upgrade.

1422.name: Superior Agility
1422.rule: **Reaction:** During an Attack action that could drive this fighter back (whether or not your opponent chose to), you can instead push them one hex.

1423.name: Swift Strike
1423.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 3 - :boom: 1] \n **Reaction:** Before making this Attack action, push this fighter one hex.

1424.name: Tethered Spirit
1424.rule: *(Errata update)* **Reaction:** During an Attack action or ploy that takes this fighter out of action, roll a defence dice. If you roll a :dfBlock: or :dfCrit: place them on any starting hex in your territory, ignore the damage and discard this upgrade (they cannot be driven back). If you cannot, they are taken out of action.

1425.name: The Blazing Key
1425.rule: If this fighter is holding objective 3 in the third end phase, score 2 glory points.

1426.name: The Dazzling Key
1426.rule: If this fighter is holding objective 4 in the third end phase, score 2 glory points.

1427.name: The Formless Key
1427.rule: If this fighter is holding an objective in the third end phase, score 1 glory point.

1428.name: The Fractured Key
1428.rule: If this fighter is holding objective 5 in the third end phase, score 2 glory points.

1429.name: The Hallowed Key
1429.rule: If this fighter is holding objective 1 in the third end phase, score 2 glory points.

1430.name: The Shadowed Key
1430.rule: If this fighter is holding objective 2 in the third end phase, score 2 glory points.

1431.name: Total Offence
1431.rule: *(Errata update)* When this fighter makes their first Attack action in an activation or power step (other than an Attack action made as part of a Charge action), you can choose for that Attack action to have +2 Dice. If you do, this fighter cannot be activated again this phase.

1432.name: Trickster's Charm
1432.rule: If this fighter is on the battlefield, you can play a single ploy card at the beginning of each action phase.

1433.name: Trusted Defender
1433.rule: You can re-roll one defence dice for this fighter when they are the target of an Attack action.

1434.name: Unparalleled Strike
1434.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 1 - :boom: 2] \n Rolls of :atSmash: are considered to be rolls of :atCrit: for this Attack action.

1435.name: Vampiric Weapon
1435.rule: When this fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action, remove one wound token from this fighter.

1436.name: War Cry
1436.rule: When this fighter makes a Charge action, their Attack actions gain Knockback 1 for that activation.

1437.name: Zealous Defender
1437.rule: This fighter is considered to have an additional supporting fighter while they are holding an objective.

2001.name: Invulnerable
2001.rule: Your leader has +1 Defence for the first Attack action in the next activation.

2002.name: Steelheart's Second
2002.rule: This fighter's Attack actions have +1 Damage when they are adjacent to a friendly leader.

2003.name: The Stage Is Set
2003.rule: Score this in an end phase if the only surviving fighters (at least 2) are leaders.

2004.name: Coveted Trophy
2004.rule: **Reaction:** Play this when your leader takes an enemy leader out of action. Gain a glory point.

2005.name: Fervent Petition
2005.rule: Score this in an end phase if three friendly Petitioners are surviving and Inspired.

2006.name: Warden's Call
2006.rule: **Action:** Choose two friendly fighters (other than your leader) and put them on Guard.

2007.name: Showin' Off
2007.rule: Score this in an end phase is your leader took two or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.

2008.name: Impress da Boss
2008.rule: +1 Damage for the first Attack action in the next activation made by a friendly fighter adjacent to your leader.

2009.name: Pride of the Lodge
2009.rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader has three or more upgrades with his warband symbol.

2010.name: Grimnir Commands
2010.rule: The first friendly fighter (other than your leader) to make a Move action (not as part of a Charge action) in the next activation has +2 Move. You can only play this if your leader is on the battlefield.

2011.name: Krrk Now Leads!
2011.rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader is out of action and a friendly fighter named Krrk is on the battlefield.

2012.name: Krrk the Clawchief
2012.rule: **Action:** Return a friendly fighter (other than Skritch) to the battlefield in an empty hex adjacent to this fighter.

2013.name: Khorne's Chosen
2013.rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader is the only surviving fighter.

2014.name: Gory Visage
2014.rule: Attack actions that target this fighter deal 1 less damage, to a minimum of 1.

2015.name: Intervention
2015.rule: Score this immediately if your leader takes an enemy holding an objective out of action.

2016.name: Raptor Strike
2016.rule: Choose an enemy fighter within four hexes of your leader. They take 1 damage.

2017.name: Bold Advance
2017.rule: Score this in the first end phase if your leader is in enemy territory.

2018.name: Drawing Focus
2018.rule: Score this immediately if your leader is chosen by three or more ploys in this phase. *(Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met)*.

2019.name: Fearless Leader
2019.rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader is the only friendly fighter adjacent to any enemy fighters.

2020.name: Great Slayer
2020.rule: Score this immediately if your leader takes three or more enemy fighters out of action in this phase. *(Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met)*.

2021.name: Impervious
2021.rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader is on the battlefield and was the target of three or more Attack actions in the preceding action phase.

2022.name: Linchpin
2022.rule: Score this immediately if your leader was a supporting fighter during three or more Attack actions in this phase. *(Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met)*.

2023.name: Neutralise
2023.rule: Score this in the first end phase if an enemy leader is out of action.

2024.name: Shining Example
2024.rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader is on the battlefield and Inspired.

2025.name: Slayer
2025.rule: Score this immediately if your leader takes two or more enemy fighters out of action in this phase. *(Able to be scored if you draw this card after the condition was met)*.

2026.name: Sufficient
2026.rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader is the only friendly fighter on the battlefield.

2027.name: Tireless Commander
2027.rule: Score this in an end phase if you activated your leader with four activations in the preceding action phase.

2028.name: Undefeated
2028.rule: Score this in the third end phase if your leader is on the battlefield.

2029.name: Well-guarded
2029.rule: Score this in an end phase if your leader is adjacent to two or more friendly fighters.

2030.name: Burden of Command
2030.rule: Choose an enemy leader. Their Move characteristic (before other modifiers) is 1 for the next activation.

2032.name: Commanding Reach
2032.rule: Your leader's first Attack action with a Range of 1 that only targets a single fighter in the next activation has a Range of 2.

2033.name: Commanding Strike
2033.rule: You can re-roll one attack dice during your leader's first Attack action in the next activation.

2034.name: Crippling Doubt
2034.rule: Choose an enemy leader. The Dice characteristic (before other modifiers) of their first Attack action in the next activation is 1.

2035.name: Final Duty
2035.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during an Attack action that will take your leader out of action, before they are removed from the battlefield. Roll an attack dice. On a roll of :atSmash: or :atCrit:, make an Attack action with them before they are removed from the battlefield.

2036.name: Great Cunning
2036.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after you play a power card in the power step. You can immediately play another power card. You can only play this if your leader is on the battlefield.

2037.name: Hidden Reserves
2037.rule: Remove one wound token from your leader's fighter card.

2038.name: Inspired Command
2038.rule: Choose a friendly fighter (other than your leader) and push them up to one hex or put them on Guard. You can only play this if your leader is on the battlefield.

2039.name: Look Out!
2039.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during an Attack action that will damage your leader. Roll a defence dice. On a roll of :dfSup1:, :dfSup2:, or :dfCrit:, choose a friendly fighter adjacent to them. That fighter suffers the damage instead, then 1 additional damage, and no fighters are driven back.

2040.name: No Retreat
2040.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during an Attack action that targets your leader, after the dice are rolled. Your leader cannot be driven back by the Attack action.

2041.name: Premonition
2041.rule: In the next activation, you can re-roll one or more defence dice when your leader is the target of an Attack action.

2042.name: Quick Advance
2042.rule: Choose up to two friendly fighters (other than your leader) and push each of them up to one hex. You can only play this if your leader is on the battlefield.

2043.name: Quick Manoeuvre
2043.rule: Choose your leader and an adjacent friendly fighter. Switch their positions.

2044.name: Tyrant's Command
2044.rule: Choose a friendly fighter (other than your leader) that has a Move token. Remove that token: that fighter is not considered to have moved for the purposes of their subsequent actions. You can only play this if your leader is on the battlefield.

2045.name: Apex Predator
2045.rule: When this fighter takes an enemy leader out of action, gain an additional glory point.

2046.name: Commanding Presence
2046.rule: This fighter is considered to be two supporting fighters when it supports another fighter.

2047.name: Commanding Shout
2047.rule: **Action:** Push a friendly fighter (other than your leader) up to two hexes.

2049.name: Hero's Mantle
2049.rule: If this fighter is on the battlefield in the third end phase, gain 1 glory point.

2050.name: Irresistible Challenge
2050.rule: **Reaction:** During an adjacent enemy fighter's Attack action, before any dice are rolled, change the target of that Attack action to this fighter and discard this card.

2051.name: Katophrane's Ring
2051.rule:
*(Errata update)* 
 **Katophrane Relic** 
 A player can only play this card by spending two glory points (instead of one) and applying the upgrade card to an eligible fighter. If this fighter has two or more **Katophrane Relics**, they gain the following (cumulative) abilities. 
 **2+ Relics: Reaction:** During an Attack action that targets this fighter, re-roll the defence dice. 
 **3+ Relics: Reaction:** During this fighter's Attack action, re-roll the attack dice. 
 **4+ Relics: Reaction:** After this fighter's action, draw two power cards. 
 **6+ Relics: Action:** Gain 4 glory points.

2052.name: Kingsbane
2052.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 2 - :boom: 3] \n If the target is a leader, you can re-roll one attack dice when making this Attack action.

2053.name: Loyal Defender
2053.rule: **Reaction:** After an enemy fighter makes a Move action and ends their move adjacent to another friendly fighter that is your leader, push this fighter up to two hexes. They must end the push adjacent to the enemy fighter.

2054.name: Master of Tactics
2054.rule: If this fighter is on the battlefield, at the beginning of the round you can draw one objective card. If you do so, discard one objective card.

2055.name: Mighty Shove
2055.rule: **Action:** Push an adjacent enemy fighter up to one hex.

2056.name: Rising to the Challenge
2056.rule: If your leader is out of action, this fighter has +1 Wounds and the Attack actions on their fighter card have +1 Dice.

2057.name: Seize the Day
2057.rule: **Reaction:** After this fighter makes a Move action (not as part of a Charge action) discard this card. They do not gain a Move token and are not considered to have moved for the purposes of their subsequent actions.

2058.name: Treacherous Second
2058.rule: **Reaction:** After an action or ploy that takes your leader out of action, if this fighter is on the battlefield, gain 1 glory point.

2059.name: Trusted Second
2059.rule: If this fighter is supporting your leader, they are considered to be two supporting fighters.

2060.name: Tyrant's Lash
2060.rule: **Reaction:** After an adjacent friendly fighter's Attack action that fails, that fighter takes 2 damage. If they survive, they can make another Attack action.

3001.name: Blessed Banishment
3001.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase.

3002.name: Devastating Blow
3002.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband took two or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.

3003.name: Fight as One
3003.rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes an Attack action with two supporting friendly fighters.

3004.name: Harness the Storm
3004.rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter successfully casts a spell.

3005.name: Heavily Armed
3005.rule: Score this in an end phase if three or more friendly fighters each have at least one upgrade.

3006.name: Magical Supremacy
3006.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband successfully cast two or more spells in the preceding action phase.

3007.name: Measured Strike
3007.rule: Score this immediately if a friendly fighter makes a successful Attack action that deals exactly enough damage to take their target out of action.

3008.name: Overwhelming Storm
3008.rule: Score this in an end phase if you have more surviving fighters *than your opponent*.

3009.name: Purify the Earth
3009.rule: Score this in an end phase if you hold an objective held by an enemy fighter at the beginning of the round.

3010.name: Aetherwing Stance
3010.rule: Friendly fighter have +1 Defence for the first Attack action in the next activation.

3011.name: Chain Lightning
3011.rule: **Gambit Spell (:MagFocus:):** If this spell is cast Scatter 3 from the caster's hex. Any enemy fighter in a hex in the chain suffers 1 damage.

3012.name: Cry of Thunder
3012.rule: **Gambit Spell (:MagChannel::MagChannel:):** If this spell is cast, choose an enemy fighter. That fighter and any fighters adjacent to that fighter suffer 1 damage.

3013.name: Empathic Conduction
3013.rule: **Gambit Spell (:MagFocus:):** If this spell is cast, choose a friendly fighter adjacent to the caster. Remove a wound token from that fighter's fighter card.

3014.name: Gather the Storm
3014.rule: **Innate (:MagChannel:)** for the next spell your warband attempts to cast. This effect persists.

3015.name: Lightning Assault
3015.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that fails. That fighter can make another Attack action that targets the same fighter.

3016.name: Lightning Step
3016.rule: The first friendly fighter to make a Move or Charge action in the next activation can move through occupied and blocked hexes, but must end their move in an empty hex.

3017.name: Safeguard Spirit
3017.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an Attack action or gambit that takes a friendly fighter adjacent to another friendly fighter out of action. Your opponent doesn't score any glory points for taking that fighter out of action.

3018.name: Stormstrike
3018.rule: +1 Damage to the first Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 in the next activation.

3019.name: Stormward
3019.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during an enemy fighter's spell or spell Attack action, if the spell is cast. Roll a magic dice. On a roll of :MagFocus: that spell is not cast and is not resolved.

3021.name: Corposant Staff
3021.rule: **Spell Action (:MagFocus:):** If this spell is cast, choose a friendly fighter. Their Attack actions with a single target have +1 Range until the end of the phase.

3022.name: Disarming Blow
3022.rule: **Reaction:** After an Attack action made by an adjacent enemy fighter that targets this fighter and fails, roll a defence dice. On a roll of :dfBlock: or :dfCrit:, select an Attack action upgrade on the attacking fighter. That upgrade is discarded.

3024.name: Hurricane Step
3024.rule: **Reaction:** After this fighter's Attack action, push this fighter up to one hex.

3025.name: Lightning Whip
3025.rule: **Reaction:** After this fighter's Attack action that succeeds, deal 1 additional damage to the target of that Attack action.

3026.name: Stunning Blow
3026.rule: **Reaction:** After an Attack action made by an adjacent enemy fighter that targets this fighter and fails, roll a defence dice. On a roll of :dfBlock: or :dfCrit:, place a Charge token next to the attacking fighter.

3027.name: Tempest's Might
3027.rule: +1 Damage to all spell Attack actions.

3028.name: Unstoppable Zeal
3028.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 1] \n **Reaction:** After this fighter's Attack action that takes an enemy fighter out of action, this fighter can make this Attack action.

3029.name: Warding Blast
3029.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 2 - :boom: 2] \n Targets all adjacent enemies - roll for each.

3030.name: As Nagash Commands
3030.rule: Score this in the third end phase if no enemy fighters are holding objectives.

3031.name: Death Sentence
3031.rule: Score this immediately if three or more friendly fighters are adjacent to the same enemy fighter.

3032.name: Drag Them Down
