6317.rule: **Dual:** Score this in an end phase \n *If:* Your warband holds two or more objectives \n *And:* No enemy fighters hold objectives.

6318.name: Unexpected Pitfall
6318.rule: **Surge, Hybrid:** Score this immediately \n *After:* An enemy fighter is taken out of action by a **lethal** hex \n *Or:* An enemy fighter is taken out of action by damage **dealt** by a gambit you played.

6319.name: Veteran Survivors
6319.rule: Score this in the third end phase if there are three or more surviving friendly **Hunters**.

6320.name: Beast Armour
6320.rule: **Gambit Spell (:MagFocus:):** If **cast**, you can **re-roll** one dice in the caster's defence rolls. This spell **persists** until the end of the round or until the caster is out of action.

6321.name: Blind Hunger
6321.rule: **Gambit Spell (:MagChannel:):** If **cast**, pick one opponent and randomly determine one power card in their hand. That card is **discarded**.

6322.name: Blindside
6322.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during an **Attack action**, before the attack roll. **Push** one friendly fighter up to 2 hexes so that they are a **supporting** fighter.

6323.name: Bloodscent
6323.rule: +2 Dice to the first **Attack action** in the next activation if the target has one or more wound tokens.

6324.name: Buried Instinct
6324.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during an **Attack action**, that targets a friendly fighter, before the attack roll. **Give** that friendly fighter one Guard token. If that friendly fighter is **Quarry**, you can also **re-roll** 1 dice in the defence roll for that **Attack action**.

6325.name: Chain Attack
6325.rule: The first **Attack action** made by a friendly fighter in the next activation has **Combo**.

6326.name: Cloaked in Shadow
6326.rule: **Choose** a fighter. Until the end of the next activation, that fighter is a **Quarry**, players cannot **choose** that fighter when a gambit is played, and that fighter cannot be **dealt** damage by gambits.

6327.name: Closing Jaws
6327.rule: Play this only in a power step following your activation. At the end of the next activation, **choose** one enemy fighter in an **edge** hex. The chosen fighter is **dealt** 1 damage.

6328.name: Collapse
6328.rule: Pick three **edge** hexes in a single group with each hex in the group adjacent to at least one other hex in the group, and all in one player's territory. Each fighter in a hex you picked is **dealt** 1 damage.

6329.name: Confusion
6329.rule: **Choose** two fighters that are adjacent to each other. **Place** each fighter in the hex that was occupied by the other fighter when you **chose** them.

6330.name: Crushing Charge
6330.rule: In the next activation, you can take the following reaction once. \n **Reaction:** After a friendly fighter's **Move action** made as part of a **Charge action**, roll one attack dice for each enemy fighter adjacent to that fighter. For each roll of :atSmash: that enemy fighter is **dealt** 1 damage.

6331.name: Dangerous Prize
6331.rule: Pick one objective token in an **empty** hex. The first fighter to move into, be **pushed** into or be **placed** in the same hex as that objective token in the next activation is **dealt** 1 damage.

6332.name: Desperate Flight
6332.rule: **Choose** one friendly fighter and **Scatter** 4 from that fighter's hex. **Push** that fighter 3 hexes along the **chain**. If a hex that fighter would be **pushed** into is **blocked** or **occupied**, do not **push** that fighter any further.

6333.name: Downwind
6333.rule: **Push** one friendly **Hunter** 1 hex closer to an enemy fighter. That enemy fighter is a **Quarry**. This effect persists until that enemy fighter is taken out of action.

6334.name: Dragged into the Darkness
6334.rule: **Choose** one enemy fighter that has one or more Move tokens. The chosen fighter is **dealt** 1 damage if that damage would take the chosen fighter out of action.

6335.name: Dulling Dart
6335.rule: **Poison** \n **Choose** one enemy fighter adjacent to one or more friendly fighters. -1 Dice (to a minimum of 1) from that enemy fighter's **Attack actions**. This effect **persists** until the end of the round or the enemy fighter is taken out of action.

6336.name: Eldritch Haze
6336.rule: **Gambit Spell (:MagFocus:):** If **cast**, the caster has +1 Defence. This spell **persists** until the end of the round or until the caster is taken out of action.

6337.name: Euphoric Dust
6337.rule: **Poison** \n **Choose** one enemy fighter adjacent to one or more friendly fighters. \n -1 Defence from that enemy fighter (to a minimum of 1) until the next power step.

6338.name: Exhaustion
6338.rule: Play this only in a power step following your activation. At the end of the next activation, **choose** one enemy fighter that made two or more actions in that activation. The chosen fighter is **dealt** 1 damage.

6339.name: Fate's Decree
6339.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an opponent makes a roll as instructed by a gambit or upgrade (but not during an **Attack action**), before the effect of the roll is resolved. The opponent must **re-roll** that roll.

6340.name: Flash of Foresight
6340.rule:
Pick one: 
 Pick one objective card in an opponent's hand. That opponent must reveal that card to you. 
 Or: 
 Look at the top card of your power or objective deck (without revealing it) and then put it back.

6341.name: Frenzied Search
6341.rule: Play this only if your warband holds one or more objectives. **Discard** one power card. If you do, **draw** up to three power cards.

6342.name: Glorious Triumph
6342.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's **Attack action** that takes an adjacent enemy fighter out of action. Your warband is considered to hold one more objective than it holds. This effect **persists** until that friendly fighter is taken out of action or until the start of the next round.

6343.name: Go to Ground
6343.rule: **Choose** one friendly fighter with no Move or Charge tokens. **Place** the chosen fighter on a **starting** hex in your territory, or if that fighter is a **Quarry**, **place** them on any hex in your territory instead. **Give** the chosen fighter one Charge token.

6344.name: Headlong Flight
6344.rule: +1 Move for the first fighter to make a **Move action** in the next activation. +2 Move instead if that fighter is a **Quarry**.

6345.name: Honest Scrap
6345.rule: Players cannot **re-roll** dice until the end of the next activation.

6346.name: Hostile Ground
6346.rule: **Choose** one enemy fighter in your territory that is on or adjacent to one or more **lethal** hexes. That fighter is **dealt** 1 damage.

6347.name: Hunt as a Pack
6347.rule: In the first **Attack action** made by a friendly fighter in the next activation, each friendly **supporting** fighter is considered to be two **supporting** fighters.

6348.name: Hunting Band
6348.rule: **Choose** one friendly **Hunter** and any number of adjacent friendly **Hunters**. **Give** each chosen fighter one Guard token.

6349.name: Hunting Bolt
6349.rule: **Gambit Spell (:MagFocus:):** If **cast**, **choose** one enemy fighter within 3 hexes of the caster. That fighter is **dealt** 1 damage, or 2 damage if it is a **Quarry**.

6350.name: Invert Terrain
6350.rule: **Gambit Spell (:MagFocus:):** If **cast**, pick one feature token within five hexes of the caster. Flip that token.

6351.name: Irresistible Vision
6351.rule: **Gambit Spell (:MagFocus::MagFocus:):** If **cast**, **push** each other fighter within 2 hexes of the caster up to 1 hex, or up to 2 hexes if that other fighter is a **Hunter**.

6352.name: Leadbone Dust
6352.rule: **Poison** \n **Choose** one enemy fighter adjacent to one or more friendly fighters. **Give** the chosen fighter one Move token. In addition, **Attack actions** that target the chosen fighter have **Ensnare**. This effect **persists** until the chosen fighter is taken out of action, or the end of the round.

6353.name: Leave Nothing to Chance
6353.rule: Pick one feature token in a hex that contains a friendly fighter. **Remove** that token from the battlefield.

6354.name: Lucky Escape
6354.rule: **Reaction:** Play this when a friendly fighter is **dealt** 1 damage precisely. That damage is not **dealt** to them.

6355.name: Madness Dart
6355.rule: **Poison** \n **Choose** one enemy fighter adjacent to one or more friendly fighters. The chosen fighter's **Attack actions** have the :atFury: characteristic instead of their printed characteristic. This effect **persists** until the chosen fighter is taken out of action.

6356.name: Malkyn Grace
6356.rule:
**Choose** one friendly fighter to have the following: 
 +2 Move 
 -1 Wounds (to a minimum of 1) 
 This effect **persists** until the end of the round or that fighter is taken out of action.

6357.name: Marked
6357.rule: **Choose** a fighter. They are a **Quarry**. This **persists** until that fighter is taken out of action.

6358.name: Mass Upheaval
6358.rule: **Gambit Spell (:MagFocus::MagFocus:):** If **cast**, roll one magic dice for each feature token in the same players territory as the caster. For each roll of :MagChannel:, flip that token. If the caster is in no one's territory, this spell fails.

6359.name: Nightmare in the Shadows
6359.rule: **Choose** one enemy fighter and **push** them 1 hex.

6360.name: Overkill
6360.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's **Attack action** that took an enemy fighter out of action, if the **Attack action dealt** more damage than was necessary to take the target out of action. Gain 1 spent glory point.

6361.name: Punch-drunk
6361.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during a friendly fighter's Range 1 or Range 2 **Attack action** that succeeds, before the drive back step. Instead of driving the target back, **Scatter** 3 from the target's hex and **push** them along the **chain** to the **end hex**. You cannot **push** them into a **blocked** or **occupied** hex. The target cannot be **trapped**.

6362.name: Quick Search
6362.rule: Play this only if your warband holds one or more objectives. **Draw** up to 2 power cards.

6363.name: Restless Prize
6363.rule: Pick one objective token and move it into an adjacent hex up to two times. You cannot move it into a **lethal** hex or a hex that includes a feature token.

6364.name: Rocksnake Toxin
6364.rule: **Poison** \n **Choose** one enemy fighter adjacent to one or more friendly fighters. The chosen fighter is **dealt** 1 damage at the end of each action phase. This effect **persists** until the chosen fighter is taken out of action.

6365.name: Scavenged Defences
6365.rule: **Choose** one friendly fighter. \n +1 Defence to the chosen fighter in the first **Attack action** in the next activation.

6366.name: Sidestep
6366.rule: **Choose** a friendly fighter and **push** them one hex.

6367.name: Sitting Target
6367.rule: The first **Attack action** made by a friendly fighter in the next activation has +1 Dice and **Ensnare** if the target has no Move or Charge tokens.

6368.name: Snare
6368.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during a friendly **Hunter's Attack action**, after it **drives back** an enemy fighter. The enemy fighter is **dealt** 1 damage.

6369.name: Spinetoad Toxin
6369.rule: **Poison** \n Choose one enemy fighter adjacent to one or more friendly fighters. The enemy fighter is **dealt** 1 damage after each **Move action** they make. This effect **persists** until the enemy fighter is out of action.

6370.name: Spiteful Dart
6370.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an enemy fighter's **Attack action** that drives a friendly fighter back, if the friendly fighter is not taken out of action. The enemy fighter is **dealt** 1 damage.

6371.name: Sudden Scarcity
6371.rule: The next time an opponent spends any glory points to give a fighter an upgrade, they must spend 1 additional glory point to do so. This effect **persists** until the end of the phase.

6372.name: The Ground Shifts
6372.rule: Pick one **lethal** hex token and **push** it 1 hex into an **empty** hex that is not a **lethal** hex and does not contain a feature token.

6373.name: Tracking
6373.rule: +1 Move to the first fighter to make a **Move action** in the next activation. +2 Move instead if that fighter is a **Hunter**.

6374.name: Unexpected Peril
6374.rule: Pick one feature token in an **empty** hex in your territory. Flip that token.

6375.name: Unnatural Truce
6375.rule: **Draw** up to two power cards. Each other player **draws** up to one power card.

6376.name: Vicious Beast
6376.rule: **Place** the scatter token on a **lethal** hex, then do the following twice. **Scatter 1** from that hex: any fighter in the **end hex** is **dealt** 1 damage.

6377.name: Victimise
6377.rule: +1 Dice to the first Range 1 or Range 2 **Attack action** made by a friendly fighter in the next activation. If that **Attack action** targets a **Quarry** you can **re-roll** any number of attack dice in the attack roll for that **Attack action**.

6378.name: Wildform
6378.rule:
**Spell:** This spell is **cast** if there are two or more of the same symbol in the casting roll. If this spell is **cast**, +1 Damage to the caster's Range 1 and Range 2 **Attack actions**, and they gain one or more of the following, corresponding to the symbols in the roll. 
 **2+** :MagChannel: : +1 Move 
 **2+** :MagFocus: : +1 Wounds 
 **2+** :MagCrit: : +1 Defence 
 This spell **persists** until the caster is taken out of action.

6379.name: Abasoth's Auto-immolation
6379.rule: **Lost Page** \n **Spell Reaction (:MagFocus:):** Use this during an enemy fighter's Range 1 **Attack action** that **deals** enough damage to take this fighter out of action, after the deal damage step. If **cast**, roll a number of attack dice equal to this fighter's Wounds characteristic. **Deal** 1 damage to their attacker for each roll of :atSmash: or :atCrit:.

6380.name: Amberbone Axe
6380.rule: [:Hex: 3 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 1] \n After this fighter makes this **Attack action**, **discard** this card. \n [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 2] If this **Attack action** takes an enemy fighter out of action, **discard** this card and gain 1 glory point.

6381.name: Amberbone Dagger
6381.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 3 - :boom: 2] \n If there are one or more :atCrit: in the attack roll, this **Attack action** has **Cleave**. If this **Attack action** takes an enemy fighter out of action, **discard** this card and gain 1 glory point.

6382.name: Amberbone Hammer
6382.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 2 -(Knockback 1)-] \n If this **Attack action** takes an enemy fighter out of action, **discard** this card and gain 1 glory point.

6383.name: Amberbone Mace
6383.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 2] \n You can **re-roll** any number of dice in the attack roll. If this **Attack action** takes an enemy fighter out of action, **discard** this card and gain 1 glory point.

6384.name: Amberbone Spear
6384.rule: [:Hex: 2 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 2] \n If this **Attack action** takes an enemy fighter out of action, **discard** this card and gain 1 glory point.

6385.name: Amberbone Sword
6385.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 3 - :boom: 2] \n If this **Attack action** takes an enemy fighter out of action, **discard** this card and gain 1 glory point.

6386.name: Avatar of the Ur-grub
6386.rule:
This card cannot be included in your deck. 
 This card cannot be removed from this fighter. 
 This fighter is a **Quarry**. 
 This fighter's Range 1 and Range 2 **Attack actions** have +1 Damage and **Ensnare**. 
 **Reaction:** After this fighter's successful Range 1 or Range 2 **Attack action**, **Heal** (1) this fighter.

6387.name: Barb-laden Net
6387.rule: [:Hex: 2 - :atFury: 3 - :boom: 1] \n If this **Attack action** is successful, **give** the target one Charge token and **discard** this card.

6389.name: Bloodthief
6389.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 2] \n **Reaction:** After this **Attack action**, if it succeeded, **Heal** (2) this fighter and **discard** this card.

6390.name: Bloody Axe
6390.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 3 - :boom: 2] \n If this fighter has 2 or more wound tokens, double the Damage characteristic of this **Attack action**.

6391.name: Caltrops
6391.rule: **Reaction:** During a Range 1 **Attack action**, after this fighter is **driven back**, but before they are **dealt** damage by any **lethal** hexes, their attacker is **dealt** 1 damage.

6392.name: Claws of the Ur-grub
6392.rule: **Ur-grub Aspect** \n This fighter's Range 1 **Attack actions** have **Ensnare**.

6393.name: Cryptic Companion
6393.rule: This fighter is a **Quarry**. If this fighter is a **Quarry** and is holding an objective at the end of an action phase, gain 1 glory point.

6394.name: Cursed Blade
6394.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 3] \n +1 Move \n You must activate this fighter in your first activation each round. At the start of this fighter's activation, **deal** 1 damage to them. After their activation, **give** them one Charge token.

6395.name: Finishing Blow
6395.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 2] \n **Reaction:** After this fighter's successful **Attack action** with **Combo**, make this **Attack action**. It must target the same fighter. +2 Damage to this **Attack action** when made in this way.

6398.name: Great Strength
6398.rule: +1 Damage to this fighter's Range 1 and Range 2 **Attack actions**.

6399.name: Greedy Gauntlet
6399.rule: **Reaction:** After this fighter's activation, **deal** 1 damage to this fighter and place one Sacrifice counter on this card. +1 Damage to this fighter's Range 1 or Range 2 **Attack actions** for each Sacrifice counter on this card.

6400.name: Hidden Presence
6400.rule: This fighter is a **Quarry**. If this fighter is a **Quarry**, players cannot **choose** this fighter when a gambit is played.

6401.name: Hungry Realmstone
6401.rule: **Reaction:** After an activation, place one Potency counter on this card and lose one glory point. \n +1 Damage to this fighter's Range 1 and Range 2 **Attack actions** for each Potency counter on this card.

6402.name: Hunter's Caution
6402.rule: This fighter is a **Hunter**. If this fighter is the target of a **Quarry's Attack action**, you can **re-roll** one dice in the defence roll.

6403.name: Hunter's Reflexes
6403.rule: This fighter is a **Hunter**. \n **Reaction:** Use this after an enemy fighter's activation, if that fighter is a **Quarry**. **Push** this fighter 1 hex closer to that enemy fighter.

6404.name: Hunter's Talisman
6404.rule: +1 Dice to this fighter's **Attack actions**. If the target is a **Quarry**, you can **re-roll** one attack dice in the attack roll.

6405.name: Hunter's Will
6405.rule: **Reaction:** After a **Quarry** moves or is **pushed** from an adjacent hex, **push** this fighter by the shortest route so that they are adjacent to that **Quarry**. If you cannot, this fighter is not **pushed**.

6406.name: Hunting Companion
6406.rule: **Reaction:** During this fighter's successful Range 1 or Range 2 **Attack action** in which you rolled one or more :atSup2: in the attack roll, after the deal damage step, the target is **dealt** 1 damage.

6407.name: Iara's Instant Shield
6407.rule: **Lost Page** \n **Spell Reaction (:MagFocus:):** Use this during an **Attack action** that targets this fighter, after the attack roll. If **cast**, you can **re-roll** any number of dice in the defence roll for that **Attack action**.

6408.name: Inescapable Blow
6408.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 2] \n **Reaction:** After this fighter's successful **Attack action** with **Combo**, make this **Attack action**. It must target the same fighter and has **Cleave** and **Ensnare**.

6410.name: Keila's Choking Coil
6410.rule: **Lost page** \n [:Hex: 3 - :MagFocus: - - :boom: 1] \n On a **critical hit**, this **Attack action** has +1 Damage.

6411.name: Larval Lance
6411.rule: [:Hex: 2 - :atSmash: - - :boom: -] \n This **Attack action's** Dice and Damage characteristics are equal to the current round number (e.g. 1 in the first round). They cannot be modified.

6412.name: Lethal Snares
6412.rule: **Reaction:** After this fighter ends a **push** or a **Move action** in a hex that contains a feature token, or is **placed** in a hex that contains a feature token, flip that token.

6413.name: Mandibles of the Ur-grub
6413.rule: **Ur-grub Aspect** \n **Reaction:** After this fighter's successful Range 1 **Attack action**, **Heal (1)** this fighter.

6414.name: Mazzig's Many Legs
6414.rule: **Lost Page** \n **Spell action (:MagChannel:):** If **cast**, **choose** another friendly fighter within 2 hexes of the caster. **Push** the chosen fighter up to 2 hexes.

6416.name: Predator's Trinket
6416.rule: This fighter is a **Quarry**. If this fighter is a **Quarry**, this fighter's Range 1 or Range 2 **Attack actions** have **Cleave**.

6417.name: Predatory Instinct
6417.rule: This fighter is a **Hunter**. You can **re-roll** one dice in the attack rolls for this fighter's **Attack actions** that target a **Quarry**.

6418.name: Prescient Blow
6418.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 1 - :boom: 1 -(Combo)-] \n This **Attack action's** Dice characteristic cannot be modified. \n **Reaction:** During an **Attack action** that targets this fighter, before the attack roll, make this **Attack action**.

6419.name: Prey's Cunning
6419.rule: This fighter is a **Quarry**. If this fighter is a **Quarry**, this fighter cannot be **dealt** damage by Gambits.

6420.name: Quintok's Combative Cantrip
6420.rule: **Lost Page** \n **Spell Action (:MagFocus:):** If **cast**, **push** one adjacent enemy fighter up to 1 hex, then **give** the caster one Guard token, then **push** the caster up to 1 hex.

6421.name: Repeating Mirror
6421.rule: **Reaction:** After an enemy **wizard casts** a spell (other than a **spell Attack action**), and that spell is resolved, resolve that spell again with the same casting roll result, but do so as if this fighter was the caster and a **wizard**. Then **discard** this card.

6422.name: Shadeglass Band
6422.rule: If there are one or more :atCrit: in this fighter's attack roll, place a Potency counter on this card. While there are one or more Potency counters on this card, you can **re-roll** one dice in this fighter's attack and defence rolls.

6423.name: Soothing Companion
6423.rule: **Reaction:** After this fighter's activation, unless this fighter made one or more **Attack actions** in that activation, **Heal** (1) this fighter.

6424.name: Soulward Shard
6424.rule: **Reaction:** After an enemy **wizard casts** a spell, before it is resolved, pick one: this fighter is **dealt** 1 damage and the spell is not resolved, or this fighter is not **dealt** damage when the spell is resolved. Then **discard** this card.

6425.name: Sprinting Charm
6425.rule: +1 Move in round 1 \n +2 Move in round 2 \n -1 Move (to a minimum of 0) in round 3.

6426.name: Stealthy Blade
6426.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 2] \n Players cannot use reactions during this **Attack action**.

6427.name: Sting of the Ur-Grub
6427.rule: **Ur-grub Aspect** \n +1 Damage to this fighter's Range 1 **Attack actions**. \n If this fighter has three or more **Ur-grub Aspects**, remove those cards from the game (they do not go into a discard pile) and **give** the Avatar of the Ur-grub upgrade to this fighter.

6428.name: Stoneform
6428.rule: -1 Move (to a minimum of 0). \n This fighter is a **Quarry**. If this fighter is a **Quarry**, this fighter cannot be **pushed**.

6429.name: Strength of Terror
6429.rule: This fighter is a **Quarry**. If this fighter is a **Quarry**, +1 Dice to this fighter's Range 1 and Range 2 **Attack actions**.

6430.name: Substance Siphon
6430.rule: This fighter's Defence characteristic is :dfDodge: X where X is the round number. Their Defence characteristic cannot be modified, and you cannot **re-roll** dice in the defence roll when this fighter is the target of an **Attack action**.

6431.name: Survival Instincts
6431.rule: This fighter is a **Quarry**. If this fighter is a **Quarry**, this fighter is on Guard.

6432.name: Terrifying Aura
6432.rule: This fighter is not and cannot be a **Quarry**. In addition, opponents cannot **re-roll** dice in attack rolls for **Attack actions** that target this fighter.

6433.name: The Scattered Tome
6433.rule: If this fighter is surviving at the end of the third action phase, gain 1 glory point for each **Lost Page** upgrade this fighter has.

6434.name: Trophy Belt
6434.rule: Gain 1 spent glory point when this fighter's **Attack action** takes an adjacent enemy fighter out of action. Gain 1 unspent glory point instead if the target was a **Quarry**.

6435.name: Victor's Experience
6435.rule: This fighter is a **Hunter**. \n **Reaction:** After a friendly fighter's **Attack action** that takes an enemy fighter out of action, if this card is in your hand, give this upgrade to that fighter. This does not cost any glory points.

6436.name: Victor's Speed
6436.rule: +1 Move \n **Reaction:** After a friendly fighter's **Attack action** that takes an enemy fighter out of action, if this card is in your hand, give this upgrade to that fighter. This does not cost any glory points.

6437.name: Vortex Stone
6437.rule: **Reaction:** After this fighter's activation, **choose** an enemy fighter within 3 hexes and **push** the chosen fighter up to 2 hexes. This **push** must bring the chosen fighter closer to this fighter each time the chosen fighter leaves a hex. Then **discard** this card.

6438.name: Warding Companion
6438.rule: When this fighter is the target of an **Attack action**, they are considered to have one more **supporting** fighter than they do.

7001.name: Bold Conquest
7001.rule: **Surge, Dual:** Score this immediately after an activation \n *If:* Your **leader** made a **Charge action** in that activation \n *And:* your **leader** is holding an objective.

7002.name: Concerted Attack
7002.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after a third or subsequent friendly fighter makes an **Attack action** that targets the same enemy fighter in this phase.

7003.name: Cover Ground
7003.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after a friendly fighter makes a **Move action** in which they enter 6 or more hexes.

7004.name: Finders of the Way
7004.rule: **Dual:** Score this in an end phase \n *If:* There are three or more surviving friendly fighters \n *And:* Each surviving friendly fighter has one or more **Cursed Key** upgrades.

7005.name: Guardians of the Way
7005.rule: **Dual:** Score this in an end phase \n *If:* Your warband holds one or more objectives \n *And:* No enemy warband holds any objectives.

7006.name: Plant a Standard
7006.rule: Score this in an end phase if your **leader** is holding an objective in enemy territory.

7007.name: Steadfast Defender
7007.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after an **Attack action** that targets a friendly fighter holding an objective, if that fighter is still holding that objective.

7008.name: Tactical Genius 1-3
7008.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband holds objectives 1, 2 and 3.

7009.name: Tactical Genius 3-5
7009.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband holds objectives 3, 4 and 5.

7010.name: Tactical Supremacy 1-2
7010.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband holds objectives 1 and 2.

7011.name: Tactical Supremacy 3-4
7011.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband holds objectives 3 and 4.

7012.name: Victorious Duel
7012.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately when your **leader's Attack action** takes an enemy **leader** out of action.

7013.name: Daylight Robbery
7013.rule: Roll one attack dice. On a roll of :atSmash: or :atCrit: take 1 unspent glory point from one opponent.

7014.name: Distraction
7014.rule: **Choose** one enemy fighter and **push** them 1 hex.

7015.name: Forward Planning
7015.rule: **Choose** one friendly fighter with no Charge tokens. **Give** that fighter one Charge token and one upgrade.

7016.name: Harnessed Power
7016.rule: **Heal (1)** each fighter that is holding an objective.

7017.name: Jealous Defence
7017.rule: **Choose** one friendly fighter with no Charge tokens holding an objective. The chosen fighter makes one **Attack action**.

7018.name: Mischievous Spirits
7018.rule: Starting with you and going clockwise, each player does the following: pick one objective that has not been moved with this ploy, and move that objective into an adjacent hex. Do this until each objective has been moved once.

7019.name: Misdirection
7019.rule: **Reaction:** Play this when a friendly fighter is chosen by a ploy. **Choose** another friendly fighter that could be chosen by that ploy. That fighter is chosen instead.

7020.name: No Time
7020.rule: Power cards cannot be played until after the next activation.

7021.name: Rebound
7021.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during an enemy fighter's **Attack action**, after the defence roll, if that **Attack action** would succeed. Roll one defence dice. On a roll of :dfDodge: or :dfCrit: the attacker is **dealt** damage equal to the Damage characteristic of the **Attack action**, and the combat sequence ends.

7022.name: Spectral Wings
7022.rule: +2 Move to the first fighter to make a **Move action** in the next activation.

7024.name: Guardian Glaive
7024.rule: [:Hex: 2 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 2] \n If this fighter is holding an objective, you can **re-roll** any number of attack dice in the attack roll.

7025.name: Lender's Lockbox
7025.rule: **Reaction:** After this fighter is removed from the battlefield, pick one of their upgrades and return it to your hand.

7026.name: Shardcaller
7026.rule: At the beginning of each action phase, you can pick one objective held by this fighter and one other objective, then **place** each objective you picked in the hex that contained the other objective.

7027.name: The Blazing Key
7027.rule: **Cursed Key** \n If this fighter is holding objective 3 in the third end phase, gain 2 glory points.

7028.name: The Dazzling Key
7028.rule: **Cursed Key** \n If this fighter is holding objective 4 in the third end phase, gain 2 glory points.

7029.name: The Formless Key
7029.rule: **Cursed Key** \n If this fighter is holding an objective in the third end phase, gain 1 glory point.

7030.name: The Fractured Key
7030.rule: **Cursed Key** \n If this fighter is holding objective 5 in the third end phase, gain 2 glory points.

7031.name: The Hallowed Key
7031.rule: **Cursed Key** \n If this fighter is holding objective 1 in the third end phase, gain 2 glory points.

7032.name: The Shadowed Key
7032.rule: **Cursed Key** \n If this fighter is holding objective 2 in the third end phase, gain 2 glory points.

8001.name: A Risky Prospect
8001.rule: **Choose** one friendly fighter and roll three magic dice. For each roll of :MagCrit:, gain 1 glory point. For each roll of :MagChannel:, **deal** 1 damage to the chosen fighter.

8002.name: At Any Cost
8002.rule: Spend three glory points. If you do, **choose** one friendly fighter with no Charge or Move tokens. That fighter makes a **Charge action**.

8003.name: Bitter Memories
8003.rule: **Reaction:** Roll two attack dice. If you roll one or more :atSmash:, **choose** a friendly fighter with one or more Raise counters. The chosen fighter makes one **Attack action**.

8004.name: Cold Fury
8004.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after you place a Raise counter on a friendly fighter's fighter card. \n +1 Damage and you can **re-roll** one attack dice in the attack roll for that fighter's next Range 1 or Range 2 **Attack action**. This effect **persists** until that fighter is taken out of action or until they make an **Attack action**.

8005.name: Distracting Wealth
8005.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during a friendly fighter's **Attack action**, after the determine success step. Spend two glory points. If you do, +1 Damage to that **Attack action**.

8006.name: Divine Reward
8006.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's **Attack action** that took one or more enemy fighters out of action. Pick on upgrade from your hand and give that friendly fighter that upgrade. That upgrade does not cost any glory points.

8007.name: Enhanced Blow
8007.rule: Spend up to two glory points. If you do, +1 Dice to the first **Attack action** in the next activation for each glory point spent.

8008.name: Fancy Footwork
8008.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's **Attack action** with **Combo** succeeds. **Draw** three power cards.

8009.name: Fractured Memories
8009.rule: -1 Defence (to a minimum of 1) from enemy fighters' defence rolls in the first **Attack action** in the next activation.

8010.name: Grand Offering
8010.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's **Attack action** that took one or more enemy fighters out of action. Spend 1 glory point. If you do, gain 1 spent glory point.

8011.name: Invigorating Return
8011.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after you place a Raise counter on a friendly fighter's fighter card. \n **Push** that fighter up to 2 hexes.

8012.name: Last Gasp
8012.rule: **Reaction:** Play this when there are enough wound tokens on a friendly fighter's fighter card for them to be taken out of action, but before they are taken out of action. **Choose** one enemy fighter within 3 hexes of that friendly fighter. **Deal** 1 damage to the chosen fighter.

8013.name: Making Ends Meet
8013.rule: Pick one of your spent glory points and turn it over to its unspent side.

8014.name: Outrageous Fortune
8014.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter is **dealt** damage in the deal damage step. Pick one of that fighter's upgrades and **discard** it. If you do, reduce that damage by 1 to a minimum of 1.

8015.name: Revel in Death
8015.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after you place a Raise counter on a friendly fighter's fighter card. Roll two magic dice. If you roll one or more :MagChannel:, gain 1 glory point.

8016.name: Shattering Howl
8016.rule: **Reaction:** Play this when there are enough wound tokens on a friendly fighter's fighter card for them to be taken out of action, but before they are taken out of action. **Choose** one enemy fighter within 3 hexes of that friendly fighter and pick one of the chosen fighter's upgrades. **Discard** that upgrade.

8017.name: Soulsurge
8017.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's **Attack action** that took one or more enemy fighters out of action. **Choose** one friendly fighter. Roll one magic dice. On a :MagChannel: that friendly fighter makes one **Attack action**.

8018.name: Strength from Death
8018.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after you place a Raise counter on a friendly fighter's fighter card. \n That fighter's Range 1 or Range 2 **Attack actions** have **Cleave** and **Ensnare**. This effect **persists** until that fighter is taken out of action or until after they make an **Attack action**.

8019.name: The Old One-Two
8019.rule: +1 Dice to the first Range 1 or Range 2 **Attack action** with **Combo** in the next activation. \n +1 Dice to the first **Attack action** made as a reaction to an **Attack action** with **Combo**. This effect **persists** until the next power step.

8020.name: Winded
8020.rule: **Choose** one friendly fighter that has one or more upgrades with **Combo**, and one enemy fighter adjacent to that fighter. Then spend 1 glory point. If you do **give** the chosen enemy fighter one Charge token.

8021.name: Ambusher
8021.rule: **Reaction:** After you place a Raise counter on this fighter's fighter card, remove this fighter from the battlefield and **place** them in an **empty** hex. Then **discard** this upgrade. \n **Reaction:** Before a friendly fighter would be taken out of action, if this card is in your hand, give this upgrade to that fighter. This does not cost a glory point.

8022.name: Audacious Feint
8022.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 4 - :boom: 1 -(Combo)-] \n This **Attack action's** Damage characteristic cannot be modified. After this **Attack action**, **give** this fighter one Guard token.

8023.name: Deserved Confidence
8023.rule:
This fighter has the following cumulative benefits, depending on how many upgrades they have: 
 **3+:** +1 Wound and this fighter cannot be **driven back**. 
 **5+:** +1 Move 
 **9+:** This fighter's **Attack actions** have **Innate** (:atFury: :atSmash:).

8024.name: Desperate Swing
8024.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 2 - :boom: 2 -(Combo)-] \n If any opponent has more glory points than you, this **Attack action** has +2 Dice.

8025.name: Draining Leech
8025.rule:
[:Hex: 3 - :atFury: 3 - :boom: 1] 
 This **Attack action's** Damage characteristic cannot be modified. 
 After this fighter makes this **Attack action**, **discard** this upgrade. 
 **Reaction:** After the deal damage step, pick one of the target's upgrades. **Discard** that upgrade.

8026.name: Flashy Follow-up
8026.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 2] \n **Reaction:** After this fighter's successful **Attack action** with **Combo**, make this **Attack action**. It must target the same fighter. When made in this way, this **Attack action** has +1 Dice and +1 Damage.

8027.name: Frenzied Assault
8027.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 1 - :boom: 1] \n This **Attack action's** Damage characteristic cannot be modified. \n **Reaction:** After this fighter successfully makes this **Attack action**, they make this **Attack action**. It must target the same fighter.

8028.name: Gauntlet of Command
8028.rule: **Mortis Relic** \n If this fighter has two or more **Mortis Relics**, +1 Wounds. \n **Reaction:** After this fighter's activation, spend 1 glory point. If you do, **push** one friendly fighter 1 hex.

8029.name: Gauntlet of Dominance
8029.rule: **Mortis Relic** \n If this fighter has two or more **Mortis Relics**, +1 Damage to this fighter's Range 1 and Range 2 **Attack actions**. \n **Reaction:** After this fighter's activation, spend 1 glory point. If you do, **push** one enemy fighter 1 hex.

8030.name: Gravesiren
8030.rule: **Reaction:** After you place a Raise counter on this fighter's fighter card, **push** one enemy fighter 1 hex. \n **Reaction:** Before a friendly fighter would be taken out of action, if this card is in your hand, give this upgrade to that fighter. This does not cost a glory point.

8031.name: Head Bash
8031.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 2] \n **Reaction:** After this fighter's successful **Attack action** with **Combo**, make this **Attack action**. It must target the same fighter. When made in this way, if this **Attack action** is successful, **give** the target one Charge token.

8032.name: Heart Thief
8032.rule: [:Hex: 4 - :atFury: 2 - :boom: 1] \n +1 Damage if the target has a greater Wounds characteristic than this fighter.

8033.name: Hungry for Vengeance
8033.rule: If this fighter has one or more Raise counters on their fighter card, +1 Dice to this fighter's Range 1 and Range 2 **Attack actions**. \n **Reaction:** Before a friendly fighter would be taken out of action, if this card is in your hand, give this upgrade to that fighter. This does not cost a glory point.

8034.name: Ignoble Blow
8034.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atFury: 3 - :boom: 2 -(Combo)-] \n In the determine success step, if you rolled the same total of **critical successes** and **successes** as the target's player (and at least one **success**), add 1 **success** to your total.

8035.name: Invigor Mortis
8035.rule: **Reaction:** After you place a Raise counter on this fighter's fighter card, **deal** 1 damage to each adjacent enemy fighter.

8036.name: Spiteful Lunge
8036.rule: **Reaction:** When there are enough wound tokens on this fighter's fighter card for them to be taken out of action, but before they are taken out of action, roll one attack dice. On a :atCrit:, **Choose** one enemy fighter within 3 hexes of this fighter. That enemy fighter is taken out of action.

8037.name: The Crown of the Dead
8037.rule: **Mortis Relic** \n If this fighter has two or more **Mortis Relics**, you can **re-roll** one attack dice in this fighter's attack rolls. \n **Reaction:** After this fighter's activation, spend 1 glory point. If you do, **draw** two power cards and then **discard** one power card.

8038.name: Tight Defence
8038.rule: **Reaction:** After the declare Attack action step, if this fighter was declared as the target of a Range 1 or Range 2 **Attack action**, **give** this fighter one Guard token.

8039.name: Vision of Glory
8039.rule: **Reaction:** After an activation, spend 1 glory point. If you do, **remove** one Move token or one Charge token from this fighter. Then **discard** this upgrade.

8040.name: Weirding Staff
8040.rule: [:Hex: 2 - :atFury: 2 - :boom: 2] \n **Reaction:** During the deal damage step, spend 2 glory points. If you do, add this fighter's wizard level to this **Attack action's** Damage characteristic.

9001.name: Diamond-bright Souls
9001.rule: **Dual:** Score this in an end phase if: \n There are three or more surviving friendly fighters \n *And:* Each surviving friendly fighter is Inspired.

9002.name: Elemental Blessing
9002.rule: **Surge, Hybrid:** Score this immediately after: \n You **remove** an aetherquartz counter from a friendly fighter when you resolve an **Elemental** ploy \n *Or:* Your warband **casts** its second or subsequent spell in the same phase.

9003.name: Force of the Avalanche
9003.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after a friendly fighter's **Attack action** that **deals** damage equal to or greater than the target's Wounds characteristic.

9004.name: Haughty Exemplars
9004.rule: Score this in an end phase if there are more surviving friendly fighters than surviving enemy fighters.

9005.name: Patience of the Mountains
9005.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after an activation if each surviving friendly fighter has one or more Guard tokens.

9006.name: Perfect Formation
9006.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after an activation if your warband holds three or more objectives.

9007.name: Perfectionists
9007.rule: Score this in an end phase if no surviving friendly fighters have aetherquartz counters.

9008.name: Purifying Light
9008.rule: Score this in an end phase if your **leader** holds an objective.

9009.name: Pursuit of Excellence
9009.rule: Score this in an end phase if one or more surviving friendly fighters each have three or more upgrades.

9010.name: Seal the Beastgrave
9010.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband holds three or more objectives.

9011.name: Unsullied Hands
9011.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after a friendly fighter's Range 3 **Attack action** that takes an enemy fighter out of action.

9012.name: Vaunted Speed
9012.rule: Score this in an end phase if a surviving friendly fighter has a higher Move characteristic than any other surviving fighter.

9013.name: Channel the Mountain
9013.rule: **Elemental** \n **Choose** one friendly fighter. You can **remove** that fighter's aetherquartz counters. If you do, **give** the chosen fighter and each adjacent friendly fighter one Guard token. \n Otherwise, **give** the chosen fighter one Guard token.

9014.name: Channel the River
9014.rule: **Elemental** \n **Choose** one friendly fighter. You can **remove** that fighter's aetherquartz counters. If you do, **push** the chosen fighter up to 3 hexes. \n Otherwise, **push** the chosen fighter 1 hex.

9015.name: Channel the Wind
9015.rule: **Elemental** \n **Choose** one friendly fighter. You can **remove** that fighter's aetherquartz counters. If you do, **deal** 1 damage to up to two enemy fighters within 2 hexes. \n Otherwise, **deal** 1 damage to one enemy fighter within 2 hexes.

9016.name: Channel the Zenith
9016.rule: **Elemental** \n **Choose** one friendly fighter. That fighter is Inspired. You can **remove** that fighter's aetherquartz counters. If you do not, this effect **persists** until the end of the round. When this effect ends, the fighter is un-Inspired.

9017.name: Dazzling Light
9017.rule: -1 Dice (to a minimum of 1) from enemy fighters' **Attack actions** in the next activation.

9018.name: Flicker of Light
9018.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during an **Attack action**, after the determine success step, if that **Attack action** would **deal** damage that would take a friendly fighter with one or more aetherquartz counters out of action. Roll one magic dice. On a roll of :MagChannel:, **remove** that fighter's aetherquartz counters and the combat sequence ends. If you cannot, this card has no effect.

9019.name: Lambent Light
9019.rule: **Gambit spell (:MagChannel::MagChannel:):** If **cast**, **choose** one enemy fighter within 4 hexes of the caster. You can **re-roll** one attack dice in a friendly fighter's attack rolls for **Attack actions** that target the chosen fighter. This effect **persists** until the end of the round or until the chosen fighter is taken out of action.

9020.name: Surety of Purpose
9020.rule: +1 Damage to the first **Attack action** made as part of a **Charge action** by a friendly fighter in the next activation.

9021.name: Tectonic Force
9021.rule: Pick one: **push** one enemy fighter 1 hex away from a friendly Bahannar, or **push** one friendly Bahannar 1 hex towards an enemy fighter.

9022.name: Untouchable Pride
9022.rule: **Choose** one friendly fighter. If that fighter has one or more aetherquartz counters, **give** that fighter one Guard token. Otherwise **Heal** (1) that fighter.

9023.name: Balanced Soul
9023.rule: You can **re-roll** one magic dice in this fighter's casting rolls and **spell Attack action** attack rolls.

9024.name: Heartstone Amulet
9024.rule: When this fighter is **dealt** damage, reduce that damage by 1 (to a minimum of 1).

9025.name: Heightened Reflexes
9025.rule: +1 Move \n **Reaction:** Use this after an enemy fighter's **Attack action**. **Remove** this fighter's aetherquartz counters. If you do, this fighter makes an **Attack action** that targets that enemy fighter. Then **discard** this card.

9026.name: Heightened Senses
9026.rule: You can **re-roll** one attack dice in this fighter's **Attack actions**. \n **Reaction:** Use this during this fighter's **Attack action**, after the attack roll. **Remove** this fighter's aetherquartz counters. If you do, that **Attack action** has **Cleave** and **Ensnare** until it is resolved. Then **discard** this card.

9027.name: Magical Boost
9027.rule: This fighter cannot be **dealt** damage by **backlash**. \n **Reaction:** Use this during this fighter's casting roll, before rolling the dice. **Remove** this fighter's aetherquartz counters. If you do, roll one additional magic dice in that casting roll. Then **discard** this card.

9028.name: Mountain Stance
9028.rule: **Cleave** cannot affect this fighter's defence rolls. \n +1 Damage to this fighter's Range 1 and Range 2 **Attack actions**  if this fighter has no Move or Charge tokens.

9029.name: Mountain's Gift
9029.rule: If this fighter has one or more aetherquartz counters, this fighter is on Guard. Otherwise, after this fighter's **Attack action** that takes an enemy fighter out of action, **give** this fighter one Guard token.

9030.name: Scryowl Familiar
9030.rule: This fighter has line of sight to each other fighter.

9031.name: Speed of Hysh
9031.rule: +1 Move \n +2 Move instead if this fighter has one or more aetherquartz counters.

9032.name: Vanari Dagger
9032.rule: [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 3 - :boom: 1] \n On a **critical hit**, this **Attack action** has +2 Damage.

9033.name: Beautiful Deaths
9033.rule: **Dual:** Score this in an end phase if: \n There are three or more surviving friendly fighters \n *And:* Three or more enemy fighters are out of action.

9034.name: Cavalcade of Madness
9034.rule: **Dual:** Score this in an end phase if: \n There are three or more surviving friendly fighters \n *And:* Each surviving friendly fighter is Inspired.

9035.name: Endless Revel
9035.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after an activation if each surviving friendly fighter has one or more Move and/or Charge tokens.

9036.name: Excess of Avidity
9036.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband holds more objectives than any other warband.

9037.name: Excess of Carnality
9037.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after an activation if two or more friendly fighters are adjacent to the same enemy fighter.

9038.name: Excess of Gluttony
9038.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after an activation if one or more friendly fighters are each adjacent to two or more enemy fighters.

9039.name: Excess of Indolency
9039.rule: **Hybrid:** Score this in an end phase if: \n There are no enemy fighters with any Move or Charge tokens \n *Or:* Your warband holds two or more objectives.

9040.name: Excess of Paramountcy
9040.rule: **Hybrid:** Score this in an end phase if: \n Your **leader** holds an objective in enemy territory \n *Or:* One or more enemy **leaders** hold an objective in your territory.

9041.name: Excess of Vainglory
9041.rule: **Surge, Hybrid:** Score this immediately after a friendly fighter's **Attack action** if: \n That **Attack action** takes an enemy fighter with two or more upgrades out of action \n *Or:* That friendly fighter has three or more upgrades.

9042.name: Godseekers
9042.rule: Score this in an end phase if each surviving friendly fighter is in enemy territory.

9043.name: Grisly Tableau
9043.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after a friendly fighter's **Attack action** that takes an enemy fighter holding an objective out of action.

9044.name: Scintillating Sadism
9044.rule: Score this in an end phase if each surviving enemy fighter has one or more wound counters.

9045.name: Bonded Bodyguard
9045.rule: **Reaction:** After another fighter's **Move action**, if that fighter is not adjacent to a friendly Slakeslash, **push** a friendly Slakeslash up to 2 hexes. After the **push**, that Slakeslash must be no more than 2 hexes from a friendly Vasillac.

9046.name: Cruel Pangs
9046.rule: **Choose** one fighter holding an objective. **Deal** 1 damage to that fighter.

9047.name: Dark Desires
9047.rule: **Choose** one enemy fighter. The chosen fighter's player must pick one: **give** that fighter one Move token or you **push** that fighter 1 hex.

9048.name: Deadly Embrace
9048.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during an enemy fighter's Range 1 and Range 2 **Attack action** that targets a friendly fighter, after the deal damage step, if the friendly fighter has been **dealt** enough damage to take them out of action. Roll one magic dice. On a roll of :MagChannel:, that friendly fighter makes an **Attack action** that must target the attacker.

9049.name: Enervating Perfume
9049.rule: -1 Damage from the first **Attack action** made in the next activation (to a minimum of 1).

9050.name: Fuelled by Sensation
9050.rule: **Choose** one friendly fighter. Pick one: **Heal** (1) that fighter, or **deal** 1 damage to that fighter.

9051.name: Lure of Slaanesh
9051.rule: **Choose** one fighter. **Push** the chosen fighter 1 hex or up to 1 hex for each surviving friendly fighter with one or more wound counters.

9052.name: Rush of Sensation
9052.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's **Attack action** that takes an enemy fighter out of action. That friendly fighter makes one **Move action**.

9053.name: Shared Pain
9053.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during an enemy fighter's **Attack action** that targets a friendly fighter, after the determine success step. When resolving the deal damage step, **choose** one friendly fighter within 3 hexes of the target. That fighter, rather than the target, is **dealt** the damage from the **Attack action**. Then the combat sequence ends.

9054.name: Vicious Barbs
9054.rule: **Choose:** one enemy fighter adjacent to one or more friendly fighters. The chosen fighter is un-Inspired and cannot be Inspired. This effect **persists** until the end of the round or until that fighter is taken out of action. When this effect ends, the chosen fighter is Inspired.

9055.name: Cruel Volley
9055.rule: **Reaction:** After this fighter's first Range 3+ **Attack action** in a round, this fighter makes a Range 3+ **Attack action**.

9056.name: Dance Without End
9056.rule: **Reaction:** After another friendly fighter's **Move action**, **push** this fighter 1 hex, or 2 hexes if you first **deal** 1 damage to this fighter.

9057.name: Distracting Ostentation
9057.rule: -1 Dice from **Attack actions** made by enemy fighters adjacent to this fighter (to a minimum of 1).

9058.name: Mark of the Dark Prince
9058.rule: **Reaction:** During this fighter's Range 1 **Attack action**, before the attack roll, **deal** 1 damage to this fighter. If you do, choose **Cleave** or **Ensnare**. The **Attack action** has that ability until it has been resolved.

9059.name: Sadistic Goad
9059.rule: [:Hex: 2 - :atFury: 3 - :boom: -] \n This **Attack action's** Damage characteristic is 1 plus the number of the target's wound counters.

9060.name: Sickening Resilience
9060.rule: When this fighter is **dealt** damage, roll one defence dice. On a roll of :dfBlock:, this fighter is only **dealt** 1 damage.

9061.name: Soporific Musk
9061.rule: Enemy fighters that begin a **Move action** within 2 hexes of this fighter have -1 Move (to a minimum of 0).

9062.name: Strength from Pain
9062.rule: +1 Damage to this fighter's Range 1 or Range 2 **Attack actions** if this fighter has one or more wound counters.

9063.name: Swift as Desire
9063.rule: +1 Move \n +2 Move instead if this fighter has one or more wounds counters.

9064.name: Sword-shatterer
9064.rule: **Reaction:** After a Range 1 or Range 2 **Attack action** which targets this fighter, roll one attack dice. On a roll of :atSmash:, pick one of the attacker's upgrades. That card is **discarded**.

9065.name: Absolute Desecration
9065.rule: Score this in the third end phase if there are four or more Desecration tokens on the battlefield.

9066.name: Brutal Desecration
9066.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after your warband **desecrates** an objective *(see Desecration Tokens)*.

9067.name: Dark Approval
9067.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after an activation in which your **leader** makes an **Attack action** that takes an enemy **leader** out of action.

9068.name: Desolate Domain
9068.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after an activation if each objective token in one or more players' territories has a Desecration token.

9069.name: Fierce Conquerors
9069.rule: **Dual:** Score this in an end phase if: \n Three or more friendly fighters are in enemy territory \n *And:* There are two or more Desecration tokens on the battlefield.

9070.name: Glorious Slaughter
9070.rule: Score this in an end phase if three or more enemy fighters are out of action.

9071.name: Hurricane of Violence
9071.rule: Score this in an end phase if friendly fighters' **Attack actions** took two or more enemy fighters in enemy territory out of action in the preceding action phase.

9072.name: Malevolent Exploits
9072.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after playing your third or subsequent power card in a single power step.

9073.name: On the Dark Road
9073.rule: **Hybrid:** Score this in an end phase if: \n One or more surviving friendly fighters each have three or more upgrades \n *Or:* Each surviving friendly fighter has one or more upgrades.

9074.name: Power of Chaos
9074.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after a friendly fighter's spell that **deals** damage that takes an enemy fighter out of action.

9075.name: Ravagers All
9075.rule: Score this in an end phase if each surviving friendly fighter is Inspired.

9076.name: Razed Realm
9076.rule: Score this in an end phase if there are two or more Desecration tokens on the battlefield.

9077.name: Eternal Vendetta
9077.rule: You can **re-roll** one attack dice in the attack roll of the first **Attack action** made by a friendly fighter in the next activation.

9078.name: Eye of the Gods
9078.rule: Play this only if one or more enemy **leaders** are out of action. Pick one: \n +1 Dice, or +1 Damage, or **Cleave**, or **Ensnare**. \n Your **leader's** Range 1 and Range 2 **Attack actions** gain that rule. This effect **persists** until that fighter is taken out of action.

9079.name: Flames of Spite
9079.rule: **Reaction:** Play this during a friendly fighter's **Attack action**, after the determine success step, if the **Attack action** resulted in a **critical hit**. +1 Damage to that **Attack action** until it has been resolved.

9080.name: Mask of Darkness
9080.rule: **Gambit Spell (:MagFocus:):** If **cast**, **choose** one friendly fighter within 3 hexes of the caster. **Place** that fighter in the same hex as an objective in enemy territory. Then **give** that fighter one move token.

9081.name: Power Reclaimed
9081.rule: Play this if your **leader** is out of action. The friendly Zarshia is a **leader**, has +1 Wounds and +1 wizard level. This effect **persists** until that fighter is taken out of action.

9082.name: Ravaging Advance
9082.rule: **Push** each friendly fighter that is not in enemy territory up to 1 hex towards enemy territory.

9083.name: Ritual Desecration
9083.rule: Pick one objective token in the same hex as a friendly fighter. **Desecrate** that objective *(see Desecration Tokens)*. That fighter is Inspired.

9084.name: Spurred On
9084.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after a friendly **leader's Move action**. **Choose** another friendly fighter. That fighter makes one **Move action**.

9085.name: Whispers of Chaos
9085.rule: **Gambit Spell (:MagFocus:):** If **cast**, **choose** one enemy fighter within 3 hexes of the caster. **Push** that fighter up to 1 hex, then pick one: **deal** 1 damage to that fighter, or **give** that fighter one Move token.

9086.name: Wrack the Land
9086.rule: Pick one objective token in an **empty** hex within 1 hex of one or more friendly fighters. **Desecrate** that objective *(see Desecration Tokens)*.

9087.name: Blasphemous Cuirass
9087.rule: When this fighter is the target of an **Attack action**, if there are one or more :dfBlock: in this fighter's defence roll, reduce the damage **dealt** by that **Attack action** by 1 (to a minimum of 1).

9088.name: Blazing Runeshield
9088.rule: Spells cannot **deal** damage to this fighter.

9090.name: Conqueror's Cloak
9090.rule: +2 Move if this fighter is making a **Charge action**.

9091.name: Desecrator Gauntlets
9091.rule: **Reaction:** After this fighter's **Move action**, **push** one adjacent enemy fighter 1 hex.

9092.name: Gifted Sorcerer
9092.rule: You can **re-roll** one dice in this fighter's casting rolls and **spell Attack action** attack rolls.

9095.name: Ruinous Might
9095.rule: +1 Damage to this fighter's Range 1 or Range 2 **Attack actions**.

9096.name: Unearthly Charisma
9096.rule: +1 Dice to other friendly fighters' Range 1 **Attack actions** if they are within 2 hexes of this fighter.

9097.name: Astromatrix Alignment
9097.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after you flip a feature token in enemy territory.

9098.name: Balance the Cosmic Equation
9098.rule: **Hybrid:** Score this in an end phase if: \n There are two or more enemy fighters out of action \n *Or:* Your warband holds more objectives than any other warband.

9099.name: Children of Azyr
9099.rule: **Dual:** Score this in an end phase if: \n Each surviving friendly fighter is Inspired. \n *And:* Surviving friendly fighters have three or more upgrades.

9100.name: Formidable Focus
9100.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after an activation if three or more friendly fighters are in enemy territory.

9101.name: Heralds of Annihilation
9101.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after an activation in which a friendly fighter made an **Attack action** that took an enemy **leader** out of action.

9102.name: Instinctive Tactics
9102.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after resolving your warbands second or subsequent reaction in the same phase.

9103.name: Perfect Warrior
9103.rule: **Dual:** Score this in an end phase if: \n There is a surviving friendly Klaq-Trok \n *And:* Each enemy **leader** is out of action.

9104.name: Seeking the Heart
9104.rule: **Hybrid:** Score this in an end phase if \n Each surviving friendly fighter is in enemy territory \n *Or:* Your warband holds each objective *in enemy territory*.

9105.name: Sotek's Hunters
9105.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after an activation in which a friendly fighter made a Range 3+ **Attack action** that took an enemy fighter out of action.

9106.name: The Great Plan
9106.rule: **Dual:** Score this in an end phase if: \n You have scored six or more objective cards \n *And:* You have scored one or more **Surge** objective cards, one or more **Dual** objective cards and one or more **Hybrid** objective cards.

9107.name: Vengeance of the Heavens
9107.rule: Score this in an end phase if there are more enemy fighters out of action than there are surviving enemy fighters.

9108.name: Will of the Slann
9108.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband holds one or more objectives in two or more players' territories.

9109.name: Burst from the Shadows
9109.rule: **Choose** up to two friendly **Hunters**. **Push** each chosen fighter up to 2 hexes.

9110.name: Huanchi's Device
9110.rule: Pick one: **push** one enemy fighter 1 hex, or pick an opponent. That player picks three fighters from their warband and **pushes** each of them 1 hex. If they have fewer than three surviving fighters, they **push** each of their surviving fighters 1 hex.

9111.name: Invisible Hunter
9111.rule: **Remove** a friendly Otapatl from the battlefield. That fighter is not out of action. This card **persists** until the end of the round. When this card no longer **persists**, **place** that fighter in any **empty** hex not adjacent to any enemy fighters. You cannot play this card in round 3.

9112.name: Light of the Stars
9112.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an opponent plays a gambit. That gambit **deals** no damage.

9113.name: Lords of Space and Time
9113.rule: **Choose** one friendly fighter that is not adjacent to any enemy fighters. **Place** that fighter in the same hex as an objective token in enemy territory, not adjacent to any enemy fighters. Then **give** that fighter one Move token.

9114.name: Sotek's Venom
9114.rule: **Poison** \n **Reaction:** Play this during a friendly fighter's **Attack action**, after the deal damage step. **Give** the target one Move token.

9115.name: Tepok's Mystery
9115.rule: Pick one opponent. That player picks one objective card from their hand and shuffles that objective card back into their objective deck. Then that player **draws** one objective card.

9116.name: The Bulwark Celestial
9116.rule: **Asterism** \n Friendly fighters cannot be **driven back**. This effect **persists** until the end of the round or until any player plays another **Asterism** card.

9117.name: The Great Drake
9117.rule: **Asterism** \n +1 Dice to friendly fighters' Range 1 **Attack actions**. This effect **persists** until the end of the round or until any player plays another **Asterism** card.

9118.name: The Hunter's Steed
9118.rule: **Asterism** \n +1 Move to friendly fighters. This effect **persists** until the end of the round or until any player plays another **Asterism** card.

9119.name: Adaptive Camouflage
9119.rule: -1 Dice (to a minimum of 1) from **Attack actions** that target this fighter if the attacker is not adjacent.

9120.name: Astrolith Igniter
9120.rule: **Reaction:** During a friendly fighter's Range 1 or Range 2 **Attack action**, before the attack roll, spend 1 glory point. That **Attack action** gains **Cleave** until it has been resolved.

9121.name: Cloak of Feathers
9121.rule: +2 Move \n When this fighter makes a **Move action**, it can move through **occupied** hexes and cannot be **dealt** damage by **lethal** hexes. It must end its **Move action** in an **empty** hex.

9122.name: Heaven-blessed Weapon
9122.rule: +1 Dice and **Knockback** 1 to this fighter's Range 1 **Attack actions**.

9123.name: Herald of the Old Ones
9123.rule: If this fighter is within 3 hexes of a friendly **Skink** that is the target of an **Attack action**, you can re-roll one defence dice in that **Skink's** defence roll.

9124.name: Selfless Sacrifice
9124.rule: **Reaction:** During an **Attack action** that targets this fighter, after the deal damage step, if this fighter will be taken out of action, this fighter makes an **Attack action**.

9125.name: Spawning Bond
9125.rule: **Reaction:** After another friendly **Skink** is **pushed** from a hex within 3 hexes, **push** this fighter 1 hex.

9126.name: Supreme Predator
9126.rule: This fighter is a **Hunter**. This fighter cannot be a **Quarry**. Each enemy fighter is a **Quarry**. You can **re-roll** one dice in this fighter's attack rolls if the target is a **Quarry**.

9127.name: Unfeeling Resilience
9127.rule: When this fighter is **dealt** damage, reduce that damage by 1 (to a minimum of 1).

9128.name: Unhesitating
9128.rule: +1 Move \n +2 Move instead if this fighter is a **Skink**.

9129.name: Blood Curse
9129.rule: **Hybrid:** Score this in the third end phase if: \n Surviving friendly fighters have ten or more Hunger counters \n *Or:* There is only one surviving enemy fighter.

9130.name: Courtly Hunt
9130.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after the first fighter is taken out of action in this round, if that fighter is an enemy fighter.

9131.name: Crimson Hounds
9131.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after an activation in which a friendly fighter made an **Attack action** that targeted an enemy fighter adjacent to one or more other friendly fighters.

9132.name: Death's Domain
9132.rule: Score this in an end phase if your warband holds all objectives in one or more players' territories.

9133.name: Gravelords
9133.rule: **Hybrid:** Score this in an end phase if: \n Two or more surviving friendly fighters are Inspired \n *Or:* Each surviving friendly fighter has two or more upgrades.

9134.name: On the Chase
9134.rule: **Hybrid:** Score this in an end phase if: \n Each surviving friendly fighter has one or more Hunger counters \n *Or:* One or more surviving friendly fighters has a Move characteristic of 6 or more.

9135.name: Preternatural Speed
9135.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after an activation if each surviving friendly fighter is in enemy territory.

9136.name: Recovered Poise
9136.rule: Score this in an end phase if one or more friendly fighters are Inspired.

9137.name: Red Ruin
9137.rule: Score this in an end phase if three or more enemy fighters are out of action.

9138.name: Spirited Attempt
9138.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after an enemy fighter's **Attack action** that **deals** damage to a friendly fighter if that friendly fighter is not out of action.

9139.name: Superlative Skill
9139.rule: **Surge, Hybrid:** Score this immediately after a friendly fighter's **Attack action** that takes the target out of action if: \n The attack roll contains only **successes** \n *Or:* That friendly fighter has no wound counters and no Hunger counters.

9140.name: Worthy Opponents
9140.rule: Score this in an end phase if one or more opponents has the same number of glory points as you or more glory points than you.

9141.name: Bestial Transformation
9141.rule: **Choose** one friendly fighter. **Discard** that fighter's upgrades. That fighter's Range 1 **Attack actions** have **Cleave** and **Ensnare** and each enemy fighter is a **Quarry**. This effect **persists** until that fighter is given an upgrade, or until that fighter is taken out of action.

9142.name: Blood Vial
9142.rule: **Choose** one friendly fighter. **Remove** up to two of the chosen fighter's Hunger counters and **Heal** (1) the chosen fighter.

9143.name: Dark Glamour
9143.rule: **Gambit Spell (:MagChannel:):** If **cast, choose** one enemy fighter within 3 hexes of the caster and **give** the chosen fighter one Move token.

9144.name: Dark Hunger
9144.rule: **Gambit Spell (:MagFocus:):** If **cast, choose** one fighter within 4 hexes of the caster and **give** the chosen fighter two Hunger counters. In addition, if **cast**, you can **remove** one Hunger counter from the caster.

9145.name: Deathly Apotheosis
9145.rule:
**Choose** one friendly fighter. 
 While that fighter has **Bloodthirst, give** that fighter one Hunger counter at the end of the action phase and **Heal** (1) that fighter each time that fighter is **given** one or more Hunger counters. 
 While that fighter is Inspired, you can **re-roll** one dice in the fighter's attack rolls. 
 This effect **persists** until that fighter is taken out of action.

9146.name: Driven to Hunt
9146.rule: Pick one: **give** one Hunger counter to each friendly fighter within 2 hexes of your **leader** or **push** one other friendly fighter within 2 hexes of your **leader** up to 1 hex.

9147.name: Mighty Strike
9147.rule: +1 Damage to the first **Attack action** make by a friendly fighter in the next activation.

9148.name: Quicksilver Advance
9148.rule: **Choose** one friendly fighter, then pick one: the chosen fighter makes one **Move action**, or you **remove** one of that fighter's Charge tokens and **give** that fighter one Move token.

9149.name: Startling Competence
9149.rule: **Reaction:** Play this after an enemy fighter's **Attack action** that **deals** damage to a friendly fighter. Pick one: **remove** one of that friendly fighter's Hunger counters, or **draw** one power card, or **push** that friendly fighter 1 hex.

9150.name: Tenebrous Form
9150.rule: **Choose** one friendly fighter. That fighter's Defence characteristic is :dfDodge: 3. That fighter cannot make attack actions or reactions, cannot **cast** spells, cannot be on Guard, cannot hold objectives and cannot be **driven back**. This effect **persists** until the end of the phase, or until that fighter is taken out of action.

9151.name: Blood Chalice
9151.rule: When you give this to a fighter, **remove** that fighter's Hunger counters. \n +1 wizard level \n This fighter cannot have Hunger counters.

9152.name: Deathly Majesty
9152.rule: -1 Dice from adjacent fighters' **Attack actions** that target this fighter, to a minimum of 1.

9153.name: Enforcer's Cloak
9153.rule: **Reaction:** After an **Attack action** that targets this fighter, **place** this fighter in an **empty** hex adjacent to the attacker. Then **discard** this card.

9154.name: Glutton for Gore
9154.rule: When this fighter is **given** one or more Hunger counters, instead **give** this fighter that many plus one additional Hunger counter. When one or more of this fighter's Hunger counters are **removed**, instead **remove** that many plus one additional Hunger counter.

9155.name: Mirror Duellist
9155.rule: This fighter is considered to have one additional **supporting** fighter.

9156.name: Ripping Claws
9156.rule: **Reaction:** After this fighter's successful Savage Assault **Attack action, deal** 1 damage to the target.

9157.name: Undying Evil
9157.rule: **Reaction:** During an **Attack action** that targets this fighter, before the deal damage step, if this fighter would be taken out of action by that **Attack action**, roll one defence dice. On a roll of :dfBlock: the combat sequence ends. After this reaction, **discard** this card.

9158.name: Vampiric Might
9158.rule: +1 Damage to this fighter's Range 1 and Range 2 **Attack actions** if this fighter is Inspired. \n +2 Damage to this fighter's Range 1 and Range 2 **Attack actions** on a **critical hit** if this fighter has **Bloodthirst**.

9159.name: Vampiric Speed
9159.rule: +1 Move \n +2 Move instead if this fighter has **Bloodthirst** or is Inspired.

9160.name: Von Marusi Armour
9160.rule: If this fighter is Inspired, reduce all damage **dealt** to this fighter by 1, to a minimum of 1. \n If this fighter has **Bloodthirst**, if this fighter would be **dealt** precisely 1 damage, this fighter is not **dealt** that damage.

9161.name: Biggest and Meanest
9161.rule: Score this in an end phase if a surviving friendly fighter has a higher Wounds characteristic than each other surviving fighter.

9162.name: Bring It On
9162.rule: **Surge, Dual:** Score this immediately after an activation if: \n An enemy fighter made an **Attack action** in that activation that targeted a friendly fighter as part of a **Charge action** \n *And:* that friendly fighter is not out of action.

9163.name: Dead Sneaky
9163.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after resolving your warband's second or subsequent reaction in the same phase.

9164.name: Ere We Go!
9164.rule: **Surge, Hybrid:** Score this immediately after an activation if: \n Each surviving friendly fighter is in enemy territory \n *Or:* Each surviving friendly fighter has one or more Charge tokens.

9165.name: Eye of Gorkamorka
9165.rule: **Dual:** Score this in an end phase if: \n You have the Primacy token \n *And:* Your **leader** holds an objective.

9166.name: Great Hunters
9166.rule: **Hybrid:** Score this in the third end phase if: \n Each surviving friendly fighter is in enemy territory and you have the Primacy token \n *Or:* There is no more than one surviving enemy fighter.

9167.name: Green Fury
9167.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after an activation in which a friendly fighter with one or more wound counters made one or more successful **Attack actions**.

9168.name: Heralds of the Waaagh!
9168.rule: Score this in an end phase if each surviving friendly fighter is Inspired.

9169.name: Hunt the World Spirit
9169.rule: **Hybrid:** Score this in an end phase if: \n Your warband holds two or more objectives and you have the Primacy token \n *Or:* Your warband holds three or more objectives.

9170.name: Smash 'Em
9170.rule: **Hybrid:** Score this in an end phase if: \n Two or more enemy fighters are out of action and you have the Primacy token \n *Or:* Three or more enemy fighters are out of action.

9171.name: Stab! Stab! Stab!
9171.rule: **Surge, Hybrid:** Score this immediately after an activation in which a friendly fighter: \n Made a successful **Attack action** with **Cleave** that targeted a fighter who was on Guard or had a :dfBlock: Defence characteristic \n *Or:* Made an **Attack action** that took an enemy fighter with a higher wounds characteristic than that friendly fighter out of action.

9172.name: Weird Omens
9172.rule: **Dual:** Score this in an end phase if: \n There are one or more friendly fighters in your territory, in no one's territory and in enemy territory \n *And:* You have the Primacy token.

9173.name: Brutal Beast Spirits
9173.rule: **Gambit Spell (:MagFocus:):** If **cast**, +1 Move to friendly fighters in the next activation when they make a **Charge action,** and +1 Dice to friendly fighters' **Attack actions** in the next activation made as part of a **Charge action**.

9174.name: Da Big Waaagh!
9174.rule: +1 Dice to friendly fighters' Range 1 **Attack actions** in the next activation. If you have the Primacy token when you play this card, this effect **persists** until you lose the Primacy token, or until the end of the round.

9175.name: Da Great Stomp
9175.rule: **Push** each friendly fighter up to 1 hex towards the nearest enemy fighter.

9176.name: Kunnin' Beast Spirits
9176.rule: **Gambit Spell (:MagChannel:):** If **cast** +1 Defence to friendly fighters in the next activation.

9177.name: Never Tiring
9177.rule: +1 Move to friendly fighters in the next activation. If you have the Primacy token when you play this card, this effect **persists** until you lose the Primacy token, or until the end of the round.

9178.name: Primal Brutality
9178.rule: Pick one: Gain the Primacy token, or discard the Primacy token. If you discard the Primacy token, **choose** one friendly fighter with no Charge tokens. The chosen fighter makes one Range 1 or Range 2 **Attack action.** Then **give** the chosen fighter one Charge token.

9179.name: Primal Kunnin'
9179.rule: **Choose** one friendly fighter. Then, if you have the Primacy token, you can give the Primacy token to an opponent. **Push** the chosen fighter 1 hex, or up to 3 hexes if you gave the Primacy token to an opponent.

9180.name: Strange Portents
9180.rule:
In the next activation: 
 :atFury: characteristics are :atSmash: characteristics and vice versa 
 :dfDodge: characteristics are :dfBlock: characteristics and vice versa 
 :MagFocus: characteristics are :MagChannel: characteristics and vice versa

9181.name: Unhinged Ferocity
9181.rule: **Reaction:** Use this after a friendly fighter's activation in which that fighter made one or more failed **Attack actions.** \n If you have the Primacy token, discard the Primacy token, then that fighter makes one **Attack action.** Otherwise, Inspire that fighter.

9182.name: Warpaint Ward
9182.rule: **Reaction:** Use this during an **Attack action** that targets a friendly fighter, before the deal damage step. Roll one magic dice: on a roll of :MagCrit:, the combat sequence ends; on a roll of :MagFocus:, instead reduce the damage **dealt** by 1, to a minimum of 1.

9183.name: Berserk Might
9183.rule: This fighter's Range 1 and Range 2 **Attack actions** have **Knockback 1.** \n +1 Damage to this fighter's Range 1 and Range 2 **Attack actions** while you have the Primacy token.

9184.name: Green God's Glare
9184.rule: You can **re-roll** once dice in this fighter's **attack** rolls for Range 3+ **Attack actions**.

9185.name: Killa Instinkt
9185.rule: This fighter's Range 1 **Attack actions** have **Cleave** and **Ensnare.**

9186.name: Lucky Bone
9186.rule: **Reaction:** After this fighter's attack roll, defence roll or casting roll, **discard** this card. If you do, you can **re-roll** any number of dice in that roll.

9187.name: Morkish Familiar
9187.rule: You can **re-roll** one dice in this fighter's casting rolls.

9188.name: Power of the Beast
9188.rule: +1 Wounds \n +2 Wounds instead while you have the Primacy token.

9189.name: Spirit of Gorkamorka
9189.rule: You can **re-roll** one dice in this fighter's attack rolls for Range 1 and Range 2 **Attack actions.**

9190.name: Spirit of the Beast
9190.rule: If you have the Primacy token when you give this upgrade to a fighter, that fighter is Inspired. \n When you gain the Primacy token, this fighter is Inspired. \n This fighter is on Guard while you have the Primacy token.

9191.name: Stamina Reserves
9191.rule: **Reaction:** After this fighter's **Move action, discard** this card. If you do, **remove** one Move token from this fighter. \n **Reaction:** After this fighter's **Charge action, discard** this card. If you do, **give** this fighter one Move token and **remove** one Charge token from this fighter.

9192.name: Thick Hide
9192.rule: If this fighter would be **dealt** precisely 1 damage, this fighter is not **dealt** that damage.

9193.name: Craft a New Order
9193.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after an activation if you have five or more tithe counters.

9194.name: Created for War
9194.rule: Score this in an end phase if friendly fighters made four or more **Attack actions** in the preceding action phase.

9195.name: Gruesome Certainty
9195.rule: **Surge:** Score this immediately after a friendly fighter's **Attack action** that resulted in a **critical hit**.

9196.name: Macabre Splendour
9196.rule: **Hybrid:** Score this in an end phase if: \n Each surviving friendly fighter is Inspired \n *Or:* One or more surviving friendly fighters each have three or more upgrades.

9197.name: Nagash's Will
9197.rule: Score this in an end phase if three or more enemy fighters are out of action.

9198.name: Peerless Conquerors
